text: UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 Draft pour into a Paulaner wheat glass. The beer is a hazy copper color with a white head of foam. The aroma is a doughy, spicy, and sweet dark malty note. Sweet and bready and spicy taste. Medium body and high carbonation. Solid beer!

Tap - big foamy head, pretty dark copper/brown color, big caramel/nutty bread malty aroma and flavor, mild earthy hop balance, good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Boca 0,5L - ravno iz obećane zemlje....ipak nije na razini svijetlog peničnog, malo vie gazirano, osjeti se čokoladni slad..

Draft at Cafe Berlin in D.C.

Mahogany body with a white, frothy sea foam head. Aromas of clove, light spice, malt. Fresh, distinctly German, and delicious.

Bottle from a Restaurant in krün. Pours hazy brown. Nose is citrus, bread, toffee. Palate is leather, citrus, faint apricot, banana. short bitter finish. Palate is quite nice, lacks a bit in the Start and the end.
50cl bottle. Hazy brown with a big tan head. Caramel, bread, banana and clove in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is balanced with bread and banana notes. Overall, a good beer.

0,5 Bottle served in weizen glass at Ristorante Pizzeria La Medusa in Torino.
Appearance: A mahogany brown with a small, creamy beige head with a good retention. Head leaves some very good lacing. Aroma: caramel wheat, clove and banana esters.
Taste: Mostly sweet, caramel malts, banana, esters, some spices. 
Thin to moderate body, 

Decent beer.(backlog rating)
Bottle in Basel. Dark brown body with big head. Nose is malty, caramel, floral. Taste is sweet, fruits, of bananas and berries. Sweet in the finish. Decent.

On tap at Alter Hackerbräuhaus. Aroma is a little sharp with rich dried fruit. Appearance is good, with slow rising bubbles through a dark cloudy brown body. Flavour starts with dried fruit, spice and bread before a lovely tartness takes over. Leaves behind banana bread. Really grew on me as I progressed through the glass.
Pours a dark hazy brown color. Aromas of bread, malt, and some fruit. Flavor has a touch of sweet malt and clove, I think. Overall, not to bad.

Medium brown with big white head. Aroma is aventinus, clove, banana. Taste also well balanced everything with a stronger sourness. Body misses the deeper tones, is a little watery. Overall complex and good.
From a bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a lasting head, mild roasted aroma, sharp upfront with a smooth finish and slight nutty flavour.

Draft in München. Let me get on my soapbox for a minute. Tickers will rate any garbage imperial stout or dog shit wild ale from a no-name brewery above basically any existing beer in these classic German styles. That aint right. Its just dumb. These beers have so much polish to them, and theres nothing like downing them alongside a big plate of bratwurst or pork roast. Also screw vegans. Meat is amazing. This draft is a hazy amber color with a large and lacy light khaki head. Great aroma- caramel, nuts, banana phenols, clove. Flavor is medium sweet, decently complex. Caramel malts and wheat both shine through. Medium body with a crisp and clean feel. Lively carbonation. Really good for a style thats no less worthy than freaking big ass 15% ABV or sour, infected BS beers in the US.

Dark brown color with big creamy white head. Aroma is tangy, caramel, caramel-coated bananas. Taste is sweet caramel and bananas, not spicy really, but a bit "herzhaft". Low carbonation. Too sweet and unbalanced for my taste. Okay beer though.
Pretty good wheat beer, but no Weihenstephaner. Flavor could be more complex.

Poured from the tap at Ottos in Willow Grove, PA. The appearance  is a light brown color with a medium sized white head. The aroma is a powerful toasted malt smell that is really pleasing. The flavor matches the aroma. A really good dunkel weisse

Draft at Edelweiss. Pours hazy copper with a fizzy off white head. Tastes like banana, malty, brown sugar, and wheat. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like bubblegum, brown sugar, and doughy malt.

Draft at Mr Beerys. Cloudy muddy brown with white head and visible yeast. Aroma of bubblegum, brown sugar And fresh ground flour. Taste is wheaty with brown sugar and banana. Reminds me a lot of banana bread. Well made and very tasty. Prost!
In Munich. Darker hazy brown, thick bubbly head. Sweet, caramel grain aroma. Body is predominantly weiss flavors. Fruity. Some malty character. Quite drinkable.
Bottle at Ashs. Pours hazy brown with a thin white head. Aromas of toffee, banana, grains. Taste is toffee, banana, light metal. Dry finish.
Bottle at ashs. Pours murky orangey brown, nose is banana, toffee, taste is similar, dry, sweet finish.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl.
Appearance - cloudy deep amber with a nice fluffy head. 
Nose - tangy orange and banana. Some slight graininess if Im being picky.
Taste - toffee and banana. Some hint of sweet spice.
Palate - close to medium bodied with a creamy and a fairly good finish. 
Overall - its dunkelweizen by numbers. Nothing extra exciting but well nailed style.
Trübe dunkel orangegoldene Farbe, schöne beige Schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifen Früchte, phenolisch, leicht hefig, Karamell. Geschmack leicht röstmalzig, phenolisch, Karamell, reife Früchte.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2015 On tap at Hackerhaus Munich. Cloudy brown beer. Lasting cream head. Good banana flavour like banana ice cream. Very tasty very easy drinking not complicated. Some sting on the finish. Light carbonation. Quite tasty. Not too much on the aroma but the banana lemon sting is good. Some breadiness.

Cloudy brown/cider color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of wheat, cloves, bananas, caramel malt, & some spice; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, caramel, clove, and some dark fruit; Nicely balanced; Good and refreshing.
* Old rating. Rated as Pschorr-Bräu Dunkle Weisse. Best before 10.10. Nice smooth and chocolate-yeasty. Spicy-fruity, round and nice.

Draft at Oktoberfest. Poured a muddy dark brown with a huge light beige fluffy head. Aroma of wheat, clove, banana, brown bread. Nice refreshing body, medium mouthfeel soft to average carbonation and a lingering aftertaste. Flavor of banana, wheat, brown bread, hint of chocolate malt.

Draught, half way up the Alps on a sunny day. Crisp brown with a full head. Aroma is spicy wheat. Flavour is sweet cloves and banana, fruity and a little malt on the finish. Fits the view and the weather perfectly.

Translucent, ruddy brownish-copper pour, good for the style. Sweet aroma, some tropical fruits. Sweet taste, pretty darn good I think, finishes relatively clean with a nice mildly bitter aftertaste. Relatively high carbonation. Big taste overall but I think there are a few better (like franziskaner)...not as crazy about this style as I used to be.

Tasted from the tap on the Mulheim an de ruhr (12/07/2014). Orange brown colour with a beige foamy head. Aroma of Banana, clove, sugar and cereals. Taste of banana, dark fruits, bread and malts. Medium carbonation and body. Next one please!
Large head misty red brown pour aromas sugary banana clove yeast lemon the flavours green banana lemon yeast sweetness candy sugary the finish best flavours spice banana sweetness okay to drink

On tap at Bitter in Vancouver. A very dark amber beer with a bit of head. Sweet caramel and fruit nose. In the mouth it is quite delectably sweet, fruity and malted. Very low bitterness, natch. Sweet lingering finish. 3.6.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2016 Draught at the Bedford-Bamberg Beer Festival 2014. Orange-brown and cloudy as hell. Traditional Hefeweizen banana/clove scent, but so much more: notes of sour citrus, bitter chocolate and malt are also detectable. The taste doesnt live up to the aroma, with a sweet rush if banana-flavoured candy and a short finish. Still, an honest beer, true to its style, and overall a lovely experience.
Bottle, pours brown with a tan head, sweet taste with malt, banana, toffee and some hints of spice, nice dunkel.

Draft to taster. Looks good for the style; a cloudy orangish brown with foamy off-white head. Smells of hefe yeast with notes of clove and some dark fruit. A bit of breadiness as well. Tastes like it smells, it not as balanced (more bready). Average on the palate. Not bad, but smells better than it tastes.
Bottle. Brownish opaque copper, minimal head. Aroma is mostly caramel malts. Taste is caramel along with grain; very sweet. Body is medium and sticky. Easy drinking.
Bottle. Pours a brown color with a decent sized foamy off white head. Notes of nuts, burnt bread, cloves, candi sugar, and wheat. Kind of a grainy mouthfeel and finish.

Pours a cloudy brown amber with a slowly fading beige head. Aroma and tat of wheat, some mild banana notes and grass, light caramel, yeast flavors as well. A medium body with mild carbonation. The finish the same as taste with a bit of a nutty yeast ending, mild wheat flavor. An enjoyable brew

Great dark wheat. Very estery lots of bananas after that hits your palette a sweet malty flavor hits. Carbonation is fairly high I was surprised. This beer is an easy drink. Over all its one you should put in your repertoire of awsome brews.

50cl bottle from Tengelmann in Munich. Pours a deep amber colored body with just a slight orange hue. Inch thick, creamy, foamy and frothy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is fairly sweet malts with some caramel and wheats, soft clove spices, a light banana ester, some bread, and a touch of citrus. Flavor is grainy and bready wheats with some caramel, a light banana, some clove, and a touch of citrus. Finishes clean and very lightly tart before leaving a medium length aftertaste. Medium body and a soft, moderately lively carbonation. Overall, a nice dunkelweizen. Clean, easy drinking, well balanced, and enjoyable. Good one.

Location/Date:Bottle split with Jay on 6/21/2013.
Appearance: Pours a clear gold.
Aroma: aroma of wheat, clove.
Taste: Light bitterness, faint clove, wheat
Palate:Light body.
Summary: Nice amount of flavor for a lower abv.

Tap at Biergarten. Pours an opaque light brown with thick, fine khaki head, great retention with minimal lacing. Aroma is wheaty, fairly sweet, banana, with a fruity, sweet finish. Moderate carbonation, medium body, and smooth texture, very drinkable. A juicy, sweet wheat beer.

Dobre ciemne piwo pszeniczne, z bardzo duza iloscia slodu, drozdzy. Piana srednia, ale jakas niewielka jej ilosc pozostaje i utrzymuje sie do konca picia. Zapach pieczonego chleba, ciasta drozdzowego i moreli. Bardzo tresciwe i smaczne piwo w stylu bawarskim
Draught at the Flying Saucer Garland. Poured a hazy amber brown with a frothy white top, nice lacing. Banana, clove, nut bread, yeast. High carb, low-medium body.
Draft at Frankford Hall. Pours brown with some fluffy head and lace.  Notes of sweet brown malts, caramel, banana, wheat and a little bread and spice. Medium mouthfeel and average carbonation.

Pours a cider like brown-amber with nearly no head at all. The bouquet is characterized by Rhone apple and cherries. Belgian yeast are noticed first with the initial pull. A dulled, not sweet, apple cider follows. An astrigent pithiness gets the final say in this average dunkel weisse. Hacker-Pschorr did ok with this one.

Orange/brown frothy white head. Bready, strong malt flavor followed by nice banana and clove. Malt plays a little bigger role than the yeast. Could be a little more hefe flavor balance. Came together more as it went on. Overall very good.
My bottle was about a year old but this didnt affect the beer much, maybe the aroma was a little "flat". Other than that a great dark bavarian weizen !
0.5 l bottle as present... Quite a good Weizen beer... Nice banana aroma, Very refreshing... I like it...

0,5 l swing top bottle BB 05/13 
brown, cloudy, frothy, tan foam. 
caramel, bread, banana, clove, dough, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation,
Tap, pours a dark brown/amber, aroma is spicy and roasty, flavour is smooth and a bit wheaty, flavour is quite tasty, easy drinking, good overall.
This beer is smooth, sweet and goes down easy.  I compare it to 30 year old scotch
tap.   pours amber with a sizeable frothy tan head.  pleasant toasted nut,  banana bread, floral leave notes.   nice beer.
Nothing special to see here folks. Kinda bland and average. Dont get me wrong, I liked it just fine, but it is nothing I would seek out.
Love this style. Great earthy and spicy malt, a bit of barnyard, with this one having a bit of dryness at the end.

Sweet orange peels come through on the nose. Darkend amber/brown appearance with a decent foam. Big malty flavors bringing coffee and burnt caramel with a bit of a coriander sweetness. Medium bodied with a subtle carbonation. Overall, a really well done brew with some fair malt complexity. Id give this a B+ rating.

Pours a murky medium brown color with a small head that lingers a bit. Aroma smells like fresh banana nut bread.  Taste is sweet and creamy, big banana flavor. Slight spiciness in the finish. Fairly high carbonation and medium body. Really nice Dunkel Weiss. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark and nutty in color, with silky head, lazy carbonation keeps the head alive during the course of the drink. Flavors of toffee and butterscotch, and a little coffe bitterness make this an easy drinker. Lovely!

Dark amber color with a tall tan head.  Fairly typical toast and bread aromas with a hint of cocoa and roast.  Some banana, light clove spiciness, and some cola.  The flavor is heavy on the toasted bread with a bit of toffee and cola.  Light banana sweetness and only a bit of clove to add some spice.  A bit one-dimensional and somewhat bland.
Normally I am not a fan of Weissbier but this one is quite nice. A little extra "wheat" taste baut not as much yeast as usual.

11.2oz bottle courtesy of Anndiesel.  Really solid appearance-wise, cloudy amber-red-brown.  Steady creamy off-white head.  Clove, banana in the aroma, a hint of brown chocolate.  A lemony hint of wheat a bite balances it out, delicate hops I guess.  Creamy body, very sessionable.  A really great Dunkelweizen.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a foamy off-white head. Aroma of toasted malts, including scents of nut and vanilla. Flavor was of weak malts and clove with vanilla and banana. Palate was slightly bitter, but finished with caramel and clove.
Supposed to have robust flavors of clove and orange, not so robust IMHO. Sweet taste and smooth, just a little dull for my taste..
Poured a brown amberish color. Aroma is of spices and sweet malts. Taste is sweet and yeast.
Bottle. Murky brown color. Soft spicy aroma with nutmeg. Soft citric, spicy flavor with banana notes and caramel. Not really exciting.

Swing-top by 03/13.  Nose out of the bottle has a lot of wheat and heavy yest slime, strong cloves, and amazing chocolate-toffee-peanut butter notes which of course fade on the way to the glass.  Sweet, sticky malt though.  Cloudy dark brown body with a rocky beige head.  Muddled malt, very sweet in the mouth, caramel and some alcohol warmth, clove dominates and combines with the sticky malt in the light-medium body.  Not super crisp, and the combo of lots of sweetness and light sourness makes it hard to consume much of.

500ml bootle. Aroma is yeast and fruits.  Appearance is brown-ish with a nice fine white head. Taste is light sour and light sweet. Malty. Has a medium body with a medium carbonation. Does have a very nice malty and long finish. Overall a great Dunkelweizen.
I smell apple, malt, cloves, when I bring it to my nose. Very smooth and creamy and a hint of hops at the right  time. Wonderful beer.....

bottled from lukas. pours dark copper with a moderate tight off white head. aromas of hay, grass and caramel. moderately sweet. light bodied, thin feel, fairly lively. quick finish with sweetness and a little citrusy bite. decent beer

Light hazy brown with a small ring of foam around the edges. Bananas, toffee, spices; a bit like liquid banana bread. Nice, delicate flavours in good balance. Banana, clove, with biscuit and toffee in the flavour. Lightto medium bodied with a slightly lingering finish.
Poured a cloudy brown color, aromas of wheat, malt, banana, and some spice.  Flavors are a mix of the aroma, with a little bit of clove aftertaste.  Decent dunkel overall.

Pours a hazy amber color with a off-white head. The nose Belgian yeast while the taste is delightful! Wheat, yeast and a hint of fruit. Would drink again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy brownish colour with a tan head. Sweet wheat and some banana in the nose. Rich flavour. Very sweet. Wheat, yeast, banana, light spicy and a solid malt background. One of the best dunkelweize I have had.[Bottle from Nurnberg in Germany]

Bottle- Pours a hazy dark bronze color with a good head that fades to some lacing. Aroma of banana, cloves and some spice and hint of malt sweetness. Taste of mild chocolate sweetness, with some banana and bit of spice. Has a mild bitterness in the background and a dry finish. Fairly light body, smooth a slightly creamy and refreshing. very nicely balanced. This is a good example of a Dunkelweizen. A relaxing beer that goes down way too easy. Well worth a try.
A really good one. Maybe its not totally objective because I really love Dukleweisse, but still...

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2012 Tap pours hazy brown with dense off white head. Aromas of bubblegum and grain are sweet. The taste is smooth and inviting, with the sweet grain complimenting the yeast. Most of the flavor seems yeasty with bubblegum, dark fruit like red grape, and some light clove and banana. Lightly spiced and big on the fruit leaves the dark grain room for taste and a lively carbonation brightens the fruit. Finishes a touch dry with a familiar German herbal hop taste, and a touch of the grainy side but it is pretty solid for a dunkel wiezen.

Tap @ Cafe Berlin, Denver. Pours hazy light burnt orange with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, sweet fruit, clove. Taste is wheat, yeasts, fruity, spices. Medium body, soft carbonation. Rather sweet, but nice and easy drinking dunkel. 060312

Pours a cloudy orange amber with a rocky head that reduces to a long-lasting 1/4".  Nice lacing that slides back into the beer.  Taste is a fresh caramel malt with a touch of candied banana and Juicy Fruit gum.  A light bitterness asserts itself at the finish.  Very solid, very drinkable, very sessionable, recommended.

Bottle.  Pours a deep, hazy orangey amber with a thin off-white head.  Aroma is malty and caramel, banana and clove.  Flavor leans more toward the malt, but all the flavors seem a bit washed out.  Understandable, though, since it was well past the drink-by date.  Finishes dry.  Farily light palate with fine carbonation.

Refrigerated 12 oz. bottle produced in September 2010, poured into a weizen glass.  Pours medium/light brown with tawny highlights with medium off-white head.  Good small bubble lacing, light/medium body, and light carbonation.  Taste is caramel malt, lots of banana, and a hit of sourness.  Average dunkelweizen, but may have been a tad past its prime.

16 ounce pint - $5.50 at Taco Mac in Canton, Georgia.

Appearance: Simply clouded, dark amber body with a medium-small, ivory hued head fed by sporadic bubble streams.

Smell: Malty notes of caramel and toast with a vibrant banana scent (the latter coming through more so here than in the flavor), malted wheat, and a low, low spice hint.

Taste: Sweetish taste of caramel glazed toasted, thick-cut wheat bread topped with a bit of banana. Slight tanginess from the wheat malt. Modest clove-like spice accent. Very lightly bitter with no more than a gentle touch of hops. Drying, neutral finish as the flavors just drop off, scrubbed away by the active suds.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation. Fluffy mouthfeel.

Overall: As with the other Hacker-Pschorr beers Ive had over the years, its firmly just OK.
Pours cloudy copper with a beige head. Aroma is roasted caramel, banana and clove. Flavour is roasted caramel, wheat, banana, clove and light acidic notes.
Chocolate, banana & wheat. Lovely colour and big creamy head. A solid dunkel that holds up very well to the rest.
Decent bananas/wheat flavor meets a good maltiness.  Solid dunkelweizen, not a flavor blast, just a good ale.

Pours a hazy and brown beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is malt, caramel and sweetness. The flavor follows the nose with additional lactose. The palate is dry with sweetness. Overall a beer below average.

From a 500 ml bottle. Brown with a hint of red. Big head, quite frothy and very stable. Nice to see. But it tastes more like a normale Hefeweizen. A bit of a roasty smell, but no roasty taste. Heavy banana. Lively carbonization, almost no bitterness. Huge body! worth a drink but not typically dunkelweizen.
Cloudy amber with a lasting white head. Aroma of bread, banana, spice and a touch of yoghurt. Dry and slightly sour malty flavour with banana and spice.

On tap. Fairly high carbonation. Aroma bready, with cloves. Flavour is malty, sweet finish of banana. Good wheat dunkle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at WOB.  Pours a dark chestnut brown color with an off white head.  Kce robust wheat aroma with notes of banana and clove.  Flavor is quite nice with a good aftertaste.

Tap at Monks Table. Deep brown cloudy pour topped by a thick, pillowy head. The aroma has the requisite clove (although the banana is fairly muted) and lots of wheaty character. Just a touch of toasted dark malt that adds a bit of complexity. Medium-bodied but highly carbonated that lends quite a bite to the brew.  A little touch of white pepper on the back of the palate as well. Lightly sweet with a bit of lingering malt on the finish. Its decent although Id prefer to see the dark malt a bit more expressive in the beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(bottle) pours a murky amber-brown colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of canned peaches, caramelized banana, herbal hops and light liquorice. flavour is roasted grain, banana and toffee, with a hint of strawberries and dried fruits. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle: Sweet, spicy, wheaty and light yeasty aroma. Hazy amber to brown color, off-white head. Flavor is light swwet, wheaty, few fruity, some raisins, roasted malt, light bitterness. Nothing special.

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of candi, wheat,bread and yeast.  Med brown hue with a white head that left little lace.  Flavor is med sweet.  Palate is meium to light bodied and watery avg.  Over all an ok brew.
Tap. Murky brown pour with a small white head. Aroma and taste of clove and banana. Bready malts. Delicious.
UPDATED: SEP 28, 2011 Tap. Pours a dark, almost muddy brown. Smells deliciously like cloves, and that carries through to the taste. Wow. Definitely a great beer.

These German brews are steadily growing on me!  This brew sports a body that is a dark amber, slightly cloudy (maybe a bit murky?) but, moreover, like dark honey that has crystallized somewhat. Topped off with a thick, frothy, bubbly white head that stays with the bear all the way through!  Warm scents of apple (like a warm apple pie), sweet malt, clovers and bananas tease the nose as you bring it close.  This brew is soooooo smooth, thick (but not chewy!!) and creamy.  Slightly fruity (apple?  banana? but only so slight) and malty (like a good malt from a fountain shop). Theres a slight hint of bitter hops but it is so well blended in with the rest of the delicious flavors of this brew that it doesnt stand out.  What a very wonderful dark wheat German beer!!

On tap, poured hazy reddish brown, almost purple looking, with white head.  Aroma was nice, notes of clove, banana, biscuit, some toffee and caramel, hints of dark fruit and roast in there as well.  Taste was like banana bread with some dark fruit in there, banana, clove, and other spices up front, went into biscuit, dark fruit, and a nice sweet and dry finish.  Tasty stuff.

...bottle from Sheps.  Nice dark beige in the glass, with a tan head that lasted.  Nice nose of dark wheat malt, clove and yeast.  Flavors were smooth vanilla, wheat malt, and some other balanced roasted noted that blended well.  Finished smooth and creamy, goes down oh so well.

bottle in a pint glass - pours amber with more beige head than I expected (had to wipe it up from the counter).  Nose is caramel malts.  Aroma is also caramel malts.  Taste is a little sweet.  Sticky texture.  Fairly generic, but not offensive.  Would love this with some food.

on draft and it was a great way to start octoberfest. great malt balance and lightness of the hops. enjoyed this beer. the white head stayed around as did the lacing served in a warm glass it was perfect. you could taste all the traditional flavors of the old style german beers. would and will drink more of this one.

From notes: bottle labelled as "Weisse Dark".  Poured hazy orange-amber with a small bone-white head.  Orangey citrus aroma mixed with mild black pepper.  Light palate, slightly thin mouthfeel.  Light orangey taste with biscuity yeast underneath.
Bottle from Total Wine, Roseville. Pours hazy copper with a foamy beige head and a toffee aroma. There is a toffee flavor with a clove-laced finish.
Medium brown. Malty wheat aroma with a sweet flavor and medium body. There was nothing wrong with this beer, it was just not very interesting. Very simple and passive.
500 mL at Hacker Pschorr Hackhaus in Munich.  Dark brown, cloudy with a good head.  Good, with a healthy wheaty aroma.  Pleasant mild weiss taste.  Sweet and refreshing.
Dark brown hazy pour, with a huge off white head. Big clove aroma mixed with some light banana, and malted wheat. Solid carb, and a good mouthfeel. Light bitter finish, and a good solid earthy clove.
Sweet but watery. Very generic dunkelweizen. This was enjoyed on the trip to München, and unfortunately no other written information is preserved.

A very hazy greyish brown color with a little golden coming through on the edges and a fluffly off-white head.  The aroma is mild citrus, bread, and clove, very nice.  The flavor is well blended, with a balance of wheat, spice, and citrus at the beginning, with a larger dose of citrus in the finish.  Not overly sweet or one dimensional, just a very nice balance.

Ausgewogener Antrunk, fruchtig-malzig, etwas süß, süffig. Die Betonung sitzt bei diesem Bier auf der Süffigkeit, denn trotz verstärkter Würzigkeit bleibt das Bier auch im Mittelteil sehr süffig und ausgewogen. Der Nachgeschmack wird deutlich malziger, wie es sich für ein dunkles Weizen gehört, dabei gelingt dem leicht süßen Ton, die Süffigkeit des Bieres beizubehalten. Zuletzt minimal bitter, guter würziger Ausklang. Musterbeispiel eines dunklen Weizens. 	 
Test vom 20.8.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,12,14,12,10,13 - 12,60

Bottle, displayed as "weiss dark".  Nutty brownish color, with a big head.  Aroma of sweet caramel malts, a bit of cocoa, and a touch of wheat barley.  Taste was very much the same.  Light cocoa, light caramel, light wheat with a yeasty twang of rust after the swallow.  Overall, not a fan.  Just a bit boring.

Drank on-tap in Munich, Germany - Banana, clove & various spices although none of which are particularly strong on the nose. A dark orange to light brown colour. Nice sized brownish white head that stays pretty well and leaves some good lacing on the glass. An excellent taste of banana and clove upfront with a nice spiciness blended through it. The drink goes down well and has a good lightness to it with a pleasant fruitiness and almost no bitterness in the finish. Smooth and refreshing feel to it. The drink is incredibly easy to drink with only the faintest fizz on the tongue from the beers carbonation. A very drinkable dunkelweizen that is smooth and goes down well. Nothing spectacular in any catergory but a good representation of the style. ***1001 Beers to try before you die: ***

Pours a slightly hazed dark amber color with a two finger yellowed white head that clings to everything. Popping the cap sends sweet wheat malts aromas wafting towards my being. Hints of various fruits, lots of clove and some banana round out the nose quite well. The taste of this pulls me in a couple of directions. Im first hit with some caramel, burnt sugar, and plums. That is followed up by and hint of lemon, clove and banana. First I think bock then its clear the hefe is in the house. Leaves a lingering spicy wheat taste on the tongue. Medium body, creamy smooth mouthfeel, lots of carbonation. Not usually something I would pick up, but I rather enjoyed this one. I could see a few of these on a warm day in my future.

Bottle says "Weisse Dark".  Pours a cloudy orange-brown with an enormous beige head.  Aroma is of banana and clove.  Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy.  Flavor is banana, wheat and a nice hint of chocolate at the end.  Very light and smooth and goes down easy!

Sample from a bottle labeled "Weisse Dark" at St. Louis Microfest 2011. Pours a cloudy brownish-amber color with some copper highlights on the edges and a thick beige head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum, nuts, sweet bready malts, clove, and some toast. Flavor follows suit pretty much exactly. Medium-bodied, with medium carbonation and a bready mouthfeel. This is pretty much exactly what I think of when I think of a dunkelweizen.
At Der Pschorr in München. Poured hazy brown in colour with tan head. Banana and yeast in aroma. Wheat and light notes of banana in flavour. Felt a bit sour in taste.

Bottle picked up at Chevy Chase in DC. Served in a weizen glass.

Pour brings a somewhat-muddy light caramel brew that isnt terribly hazy. Off-white head with a bit of lacing and not too much retention. The nose brings some light dark malts and even a hint of chocolate along with clove and a bit of banana. The taste doesnt offer too much more and is a bit plain--its almost as if the malt was to be the focus in this beer rather than the yeast. Mouthfeel is fairly light with a touch of carbonation. Drinks decently enough, but there was nothing really getting me to finish the bottle.

Serving type: bottle

bottle.  Pours muddy brown with nice sustaining light grey head.  Aroma of dark fruits - fig, raisin, with some smoke, sweet hickory, also some clove, some burnt sugar.  Medium carbonation, smooth, creamy, flavorful, refreshing.  Flavor is spiced wheat, slightly sweet but only a bit.  Nice dunkelweizen, full of flavor yet refreshing, very enjoyable.

Pours fairly light brown with lots of haze.  Pillowy head.  Its got a lot of the hefeweizen aromas - the banana and clove but with a beefed up roasty malt presence that adds some heft and bitterness to it.  I could be mistaken but I think I got a surprising amount of hop bitterness in the finish which seemed unusual for the style.  Its such a contradictory style with the light weizen and the roasty dunkel part but Hacker does as well as anyone.

Chevy Chase Wine and Liquors, DC 12oz ($2.19): Pours a really muddy color with bits of sediment floating about like it aint no thang. Notes of banana, spice, earth, and a tinge of fruitiness. Taste is pretty solid. Modicum of sweetness. Minor bitterness and astringency. Solid malt backbone, although that does not prevent it from being light bodied. Really easy to drink and with enough complexity to sip (although, right now I would be hard-pressed to do that). Also my bottle was a bit old and this beer is past its prime, but still quite good.

Bottle as weiss dark.  Pour is a hazy brown with an average tan head.  Aroma is of dark fruit and brown sugar.  Flavor is molasses, dark fruit and again some brown sugar.  Tastes exactly how it smells which is a good thing.  Maybe a little watery comparied to some american craft versions but this is still a good beer.

Appearance:  medium amber with coppery/orange notes; one-finger light tan head.   Aroma:    dark brown banana bread, notes of clove, bubblegum, and butterscotch, with a hint of sweat.   Taste:  wheat and darker malts, with strong banana flavors.   Finish:   smooth and relatively short, but with a slightly funky tang.   Notes:  	Solid example of the style.  Definitely a more malty take on a traditional HW.  My bottle was labeled Weisse Dark.

12 oz bottle, produced on 10/09.

Pours a reddish brown with yellow/orange at the thin part of the weizen glass. The head is active, off-white, and large, but it recedes quickly.

There is an abundance of lemon and banana in the scent, with some slight wheat and clove. 

The taste is a bit more caramally, but also a bit watery. There is a significant amount of clove in the taste along with a hint of lemon and banana.

Overall it is a pleasant beer, would be a thirst quencher in the summer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-15-2010 01:45:06

Draft pour. Pours a rich copper color. Nose is malty with a hint of sweetness. Rich dark lager. Some sweetness, with hints of light fruit. Solid malts finish this with a slightly sweet finish. Light tasty and easy to drink.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2012 Bottle @ home, picked up at Wilburs Foco. Pours a cloudy brown appearance with a medium sized, light brown head. Spicy, gingerbread cookie, toasty caramel, wheat malty, rich banana, zippy yeasty aroma. Somewhat light bodied. A touch tart, mostly toasty malty, caramel, light toffee, spritzy/spicy yeasty, banana flavor. One of my favorite dunkelweizens and a go-to session ale for me.

Bottle courtesy pikapp327. Labeled as Weisse Dark. Pours a clear orange color with white head. Aroma is sweet wheat, orange and yeast notes. Flavor is soured grain and wheat. Odd flavor and weird finish.
Bottle from pikapp327.  Murky brown pour with a small white head.  A little malty, some bread, nuts, and brown sugar.  Taste is very smooth, caramel, roasted nuts, and a little sweet.

500ml bottle!
Color very dark, looks like a Weizen mixed with Coke! Smells something but dominated by banana. Smells very good I think. Starts also quite tasty, wheaty und bana aromas, very fruity! In the aftertaste, banana is dominating, the body holds more overcast and yeasty.

Dark brown pour with a two finger brownish white fluffy head.  Little lacing and decent retention.  Smells of dark fruits and roasted malts.  Some sweetness and spiciness in there as well.  Tastes of spices, banana and dark fruits.  Very similar to the smell.  Caramel and a bit more watered down than I expected.  Medium bodied, but still not what I wanted from this one.

500 ml bottle. Aroma is massive sweet malt caramel. Flavor is also sweet caramel with a good wheat character and hints of molasses well as a banana aftertaste in the finish,  balances the initial sweet impression. Mildly spicy and clovey, just a hint of clove with a dry and refreshing finish that is medium in duration. A nice Dunkleweizen. Sampled with liveFREEorRYE

Sweet malt aroma with a mix of dried fruit (prunes, raisins and such). Muted cloudy brown leather in color. Nice balance of malt and hops flavor. This is why I love this brew. Clean tasting and smooth. Overall a smooth and easy drinking beer. Hacker-Pschorr knows what they are doing.
On tap in Munich. Color dark mahogany with light brown color. Aroma fruity, hints of banana. Taste, citrus, caramel, roasted grain, nice bittersweet finish. Drinkable beer.

On tap at The Village Idiot. Appearance: Murky brown with a small white head. Aroma: burnt malt, toast, lots of yeast, some winter fruit; figs, plums. Flavour: cherry, lots of vanilla, toast, caramel, cocoa notes, a good amount of dark fruitiness, long yeasty finish. Delicious.

Poured from bottle. Great nose of spice, clove, a bit of banana, and dark fruit. Color is a brown-gold with a long-lasting, solid head. The flavor is an excellent melding of hefe and the slight roasty edge of dunkel. Finish is clean and crisp, with dryness. Good.
Nice cloudy hazy brown with rich frothy head; looks great; taste is smooth complex with spicy afternotes; best dunkle weisse Ive had

a pleasant looking and tasting brew of interest when the time is appropriate such as warm sunny afternoons. smoothish and soft with banana and spice (clove and coriander) flavors and a yeasty body. the beer is sweet and refreshing, not thick yet a bit slick and grainy looking. this brew is moderate in body and has a light malt flavor. good.

Aroma of molasses, caramel and light cloves. Appearance is ruddy brown with tan head. Flavor matches the nose. Palate is bubbly, with a light fluffiness. Just a really well done German beer. A beer that you wish you could drink the rest of the evening.

[2901-20100610] Tap. Sweet banana boozy malt aroma. Hazy, dark brown body with a long-lasting foamy off-white head. Banana bran-like malt flavour with a long grainy banana aftertaste. Medium body. Good, drinkable.
(@ beerbistro, Toronto, ON; w/ jerc)

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2010 On tap; pours a golden brown, great head. Aroma of cloves; taste of cloves and oranges/citrusy. Very easy drinking, no bitterness at all. A great dunkel weisse. Updated July 21 - again very good. This is my currect favorite dunkel weisse (on tap feierbrand-seattle)

[Tap] Pours a muddy looking dark golden color with a dense white head. Aroma of wheat, darker malts like molasses and yeast. The taste is of cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, banana, some cocoa, and dark roasted malts. The malt bill here is well balanced and gives a solid backbone and nice palate. Prickly carbonation. A very good dunkelweizen!
Dark amber.  Aroma of spices,yeast, bread and caramel.  Flavor is creamy and yeasty. Spices and bready notes.  Good brew.
VEry nice, I still dont get why dark weizen are softer than the normal ones. IN barley is the opposite. Creamy and nice cloudy features.

The color is a clear but dark gold. Has a thin, dishsoap head that suprisingly sticks around for a bit. 

It is a sweet but very pungent dark wheat flavor. Very sour. 

The beer may be too old (drank in October, brewed in April). It has a stale, cellared flavor. Very sour and pungent, and not in a pleasant way. Apparently this beer doesnt age very well. 

You would think that this beer would be thick, but it is much thinner than expected. The aftertaste is sour and not in the way I think the brewer intended. It has too much of an overwhelming alcohol flavor to be the smooth dunkel-weisse I was hoping for. Apparently it doesnt age very well.
Very nice dark muddy brown pour. Nose and taste of caramel malts, banana, cloves and spices and fruits. Rated 6/15/02

Bottle @ Bayernhaus KL. Cloudy dark amber-brown with stable tan head and some glow. Aroma is nice bready wheat malt. Clean but very slight medicinal quality in the flavors. Medium to light palate. Not sticky. Clean finish with some acidity. Pretty good.

On Tap:

puts a lightly clouded cooper-tea colored ale in the flute, nice puffy off white cap- good retention and glass lacing....lively natural carbonation.

Aroma of dark toffee, roast grains, toasted wheat, big on fruits> banana, exotic fruits, some clove and spice...very pungent aroma.

Flavor profile sees roast malts and dark toffee up front  almost instantly balanced with fruity-spicey complexity, some cocoa, some mustiness....long drying finish with some herbal hopping pucker.

This is my favorite H-S Weissbier...just loaded with favor, refreshing and sessionable.

Hacker-Pschorr Brauerei Munich--Dunkel Weisse--1998 16.9 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  (3.75 / 5.0)  Dunkelweizen--Cloudy unappealing dirty light brown color.  Big pellicle and big thin head.  Light fruit flavor to relatively rich malty body with hints of roasted flavor and cherry caramel flavor.  Finishes refreshing.  Sampled 3/14/1999.

A- Quite cloudy translucent medium brown body that pours with a large white head. Head fades rather quickly to nothing. No lacing left behind in the glass.

S- Mild nose that is heavy on banana. Sour doughy smell in the background.

T- Initial taste is surprisingly tart. Sour yeast upfront with lots of banana and hints of clove. The banana fades for the finish which is a nice combination of tartness and sweetness from the yeast. What lingers is sweet bready yeast and hints of spicy clove.

M- Low carbonation and a nice full-bodied yeastiness to it. Very smooth and creamy.

D- This is a good drinkable beer that I will have again. Nice example of a dunkel weizen. I wish this style was as common as the hefe weizen.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-18-2007 16:30:07

On tap at Chancey Smiths, London.  Hazy brown with thick head.  Looks almost like a glass of dirty water.  Smells good though, lots of banana and spice.  Tastes of banana and clove, but the dark malts seem to keep them more in the background.  Nice beer.
Bottle. pours a cloudy amber with a copious head that forms stiff peaks. Aroma consists of caramel, bread, and dark fruit or candi sugar. Tastes slightly sweet has a light body and is very drinkable.

Bottle and served in weizen glass: Pours a mahogany brown with a small but lasting creamy beige head and very good lace. The aroma has notes of caramel and toasted malts, some dark wheat, clove and banana esters, and a leathery vapour. The taste is mostly sweet malt driven with a moderate fruity and slight spice background. A very light noble hop bitterness is found around the edges. The mouth feel is a tad chalky and thin but is also refreshing enough. Overall a good but not great example of the genre.

Medium chestnut brown with clouds and haze.  Aroma of sweet caramel and bubblegum.  Malts dominate the flavor, but also a bit of hops at the finish.  Some chocolate and cinnamon.  Good example of the style.

This is a nice malty sweet weisse. Its is medium to dark color that has a yeasty haze.  Lightly hopped.  Rich dark malt flavors of roasted carmels and chocolate.  The yeast bring bananas to the malt and wheat aromas.

Poured from the bottle into a frosty mug.

The color is dark amber, slightly hazy with some slight white head. No lacing.

The smell is a hearty wheat flavor. It feels like the the dark labels temple to ray in. It was just what the doctor ordered. A mix of wet hops and some sweet malts.

The taste i just a problematic mineral vice. It has just the right amount of flavor with some roasted malt and well as a wheaty/fruity flavor to this beer as well.

This beer has a medium body and is pretty carbonated. It has some nice drinkability and is pretty easy on the palate.

355ml bottle, Weiße Dark.  Hazy, reddish-brown color, white head.  Aroma of toasted puffed wheat and bananas.  Flavor of burnt caramel, wheat, and ripened bananas.  Textbook to the style.  Light-medium bodied.  Finishes with lots of fruity esters.

50 cL bottle. Pours hazy dark brown/orange with a huge off-white head. Aroma is fruity and estery. Malty, overripe fruity, banana and a bit of citric oranges in the flavour. Dry estery and wheaty finish. Mild bitterness into the far finish.

500 ML flip-bottle in Germany. Very nice dunkel weisse. Muddy brown color with a big foamy light brown head. Nice nutty banana, citrus and clove aroma. Vvery smooth mouthfeel and has a great baked bread taste. Malty with just the right caramelized sweetness, ends with a sour palate. Great stuff.
Brown - orang e colour with an off-white head. Aroma is orange, citrus, caramel. Flavour is orange, citrus, caramel, malt, banana. Nice easy drinkable beer.

Bottle from Jakes Bar and Bistro Steilacoom-- they usually only have tap beer (42 specialty taps) but they happened to have a few bottles of this beer leftover from their Oktoberfest party, the beer doesnt look fantastic to me, its super cloudy with a real murky quality but the flavor and mouthfeel are terrific! After one I really wanted another, so I had one! really nice malt and Christmas bread spice to it...

Bottle: Dark amber, light head and light lacing. Nose of banana and clove (moderate esters). Light hallertau and subtle caramel. The flavor is balanced, some wheat and yeast. A little dull, lacking flair but solid. Average finish, earthy and nutty tail.
A good beer, but as far as Dunkel Weisses go, you can get better.  The caramely aspects of this one stand out though.
Botella. Muddy amber colour (what happens when you are last in line to taste). Sweet yeasty wheat caramel aroma. The flavour is sweet with whea, caramel yeast and some dark fruittowards the end.

Bottle 50cl. w. swing top @ The Danish Summer Gathering, TSODRBSG09.Unclear hazy medium to dark orange amber color with a average, frothy to frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, caramel, moderate yeasty, ripe banana, clove notes. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft. [20090822]
Bottle, 5.3%. The aroma has some banana, a bit weak, thoug. Cloudy brown colour. OK stable off-white head. The flavour also has a hint of banana, mild and rounded.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Hazy amber golden with an off-white head. Aroma of overripe fruit, caramel and yeast. Medium body, banana, citrus and yeast with a light underlying tartness. Finishes dry. 220809

Its unclear, light brown with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of clove, banana and wheat. The flavor has sweetness and notes of clove, banana, caramel and wheat. Surprisingly much flavor for being a dunkel weisse, quite nice!

~Cloudy copperish brown color with a lasting ,thick, creamy, off white head. 
~Scent of banana, caramel malts, clove, and bready wheat. No hops detected.
~Fairly strong clove and banana flavor with bready wheat. Clove dominates than subdued by banana esters. No hops detected.
~Medium light bodied with high carbonation. Sweet spicy clove finish.
~Great Dunkelweizen. I wish mouth feel was a bit fuller. Feels somewhat thin. Delicious beer nonetheless.
Bottle @ danish RB Gathering 09. Pours unclear dark brown with a small creamy head. Sweet malty. Caramel and wheat. Smooth and simple.
Bottle. Low white quickly disappearing head. Hazy orange body. Banana apple pear aroma. Sweet and mild banana apple pear flavor with a bit of spices. Low carbonation, long aftertaste.

clody brown, small white head.
nice spicy fruity aroma, mild and balanced.
flavor is peach, wheat, faint citrus, well balanced. mild and smooth.
Hazy dark amber with a huge beige head. Aroma was sweet with roasted malt, caramel and banana notes. Sweet malty flavour with yeasty and wheat notes.

Bottled. An unclear orange-brown beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has strong notes of wheat and caramel, as well as some banana and bread. The flavor is sweet with notes of banana, wheat, caramel, and some bread, leading to a dry wheaty finish.

Bottle. A murky, brown beer wtih a two-finger dense and lasting off-white head. The aroma is dominated by banana and toffee, a nice blend, with cloves and some faint notes of hops joining in. Effervescent and full-bodied, with a nice, toffee-ish sweetness to go with the banana and cloves. I would maybe have like a bit more pronounced bitterness. Anyway, its a tasteful beer, and when cold its very refreshing too. Sure a beer worth drinking. (090807)

From Full Throttle Bottles in Seattle, WA.  Poured out a murky dark brown beneath a smallish head.  Aroma was nice enough, in a citrus kind of way.  Taste was not unlike a typical Hefe, but the mouthfeel was somewhat thicker.  Slightly sweet at the finish along with some citrus tang.
Draft pitchers @ Gustavs, light red/brown smell is mostly clove. Flavor is clove as well, malty sweet as well.

The aroma is good. It has bananas, bread, bubble gum, brown sugar, cloves, and yeast. The appearance is light brown and hazy with an average head. The flavor is like the aroma with a sweet, clean finish. The palate is thin but smooth making it refreshing for a dark beer. The beer overall is nice to drink.

Light brown pour, bit of red in it. Smells of clove and wheat, light caramel malt. Flavor much the same, very prominent clove flavor almost in danger of overpowering everything else though. Solid brew.

Pours a hazy brown with a red tinge which almost makes it purple and a large white head. Aroma is esthers, spices, malts, wheat, banana, cloves. Flavor is spices, banana, wheat, roast, caramel, nuts, dough. Prickly carbonation and a little bitterness in the finish.

Thanks 17thfloor! Pours a hazy dark orange brown with a thick pillowy white head. Very sweet banana, cloves, sugary malts and yeasty goodness. Flavor starts with a nice soft banana creaminess and picks up a nice wheat character that works well with the slightly spicy notes. Finishes with a small amount of bitterness and some acidity. Medium body and a pretty soft carbonation. Nice refreshing beer but nothing standing out too much.
Pours hazy golden brown with thick white head. Aroma is fruity with some banana and bubblegum. Flavors are essentially the same. Not quite as flavorful as I would like, but pretty good stuff.

(swing top bottle) Hazy, amber colour with a fluffy light-beige foam. Slightly sourish and minimal toasty aroma with notes of banana combined with a present wheaty and quite strong clovy touch and a tinge of malty sweetness. Light-bitter and tart flavour with shades of acidity in the background. Toasty, slightly ashy taste with a moderate wheat-character, restrained fruity notes and almost harsh cloves towards the slightly bitter and faint acidic finish. Doesn´t work for me so well, otherwise a real toasty Dunkelweizen (30.IV.09).

Pours a murky brown orange with a very large off-white foamy froth on top.  Sweet phenolic aroma, banana, crystalized brown sugar, clove.  Bananas foster flavor, sweet and rich, lightly nutty, slightly metallic, nice light spiciness, a bit chewy though.  Medium body, sugary with softer sizzling carbonation.  A good beer but hard to tell its a dunkel.

12oz "dark wiesse" bottle thanks to 17thfloor.  Cloudy light brown with medium pancake, creamy, beige head with lacing.  Aroma is yeasty, light, nutty, wheat and caramel.  Flavor is nutty, wheat, slight graininess, only a slight banana and clove.  Medium body and light carbonation.  A really tasty brew.

Bottled (from beerangel.de). Hazy nutbrown colour with big creamy beige head. Aroma is banana, some fruits and caramel malts along with some mild yeastyness. Flavour is banana, wheat, caramel malts, some nuttyness and also mild cheesy notes in the background. Tonguetickling carbonation, yet very smooth to drink.

500 ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy brown with a large, foamy, clingy beige head that lasts.  Has a lot of bubbles rising from the bottom.  Taste is of yeast, wheat, fruit, spice and some banana.  Similar aroma.  Has a slight tingly mouthfeel, but has a thin body and is on the watery side.  Very clean and easy to drink.  Looks good, but the taste is rather disappointing.  Not bad, but a forgettable beer.

Found this in Okinawa this past week. Pours out a dark murky brown with a rather large tan head to it. However, the head doesnt last long and isnt really satisfying, exciting at first but quick to let you down, probably just like your first teeth grinding experience with head when you and your lady were 15 or so. Aroama is the typical banana-clove combo you would find in most weisse beers. Flavor is sweet and yeasty, doughy, and hay-like. It was accented by a slight fruity flavor of plum. Not bad, but again not the best thing in the world.

Bottle of "Hacker-Pschorr Weisse Dark" which is the American alias, I would assume.  Aroma is like a dry Bananas Foster.  Quite banana-y in the flavor as well, with hints of clove on the finish.  Well made and tasty.
Very nice beer.  Aroma of bananas and some cloves, with hints of roasted malt in the background.  Flavor is similar, with citrus, followed by a roasted malty finish.
Bottle Pours out a a nice copper topped with a small white head. Aroma was of sweet malts and honey. Tast was very nice more of the sweetness and light spice. Pretty tasty.

12 oz bottle purchased at the Beer Run in Chattanooga.  Poured a hazy brown color with a two finger tan head.  The aroma was sweet, with clove and a bit of caramel.  The flavor was fruity, with clove present.  The palate was average, with good carbonation, a clean mouthfeel and a medium body.  I really enjoyed this beer.  I didnt expect much, as I am generally disappointed by these types of beer.  This one is an exception.

Pours a cloudy dark brown with a large fluffy off-white head. The nose is a solid, sweet, hearty wheat malt with supporting notes of dark caramel and clove. Light bodied and fairly aqueous with a slight wheaty graininess and a clean finish. Sweet, grainy, subtle dark caramel wheaty malt and cloves. A fairly straightforward dunkelweizen, its not particularly exciting, but it is very drinkable.
Bottle:  Light brown and orangish pour with a thin head.  Nose is fruity with yeast and cloves.  Tastes soft and mellow.  Malty sweet fruity with more light spices.  Rather tame.

Another german beer, another dissapointing waste of money.  Pours like iced tea with little to no head.  Smells like the typical sour german dunkelweizen.  Had a wheaty, sour banana taste.  I am so glad I dont live in Germany so I dont have to drink shitty ass beers.  I dont know how people drink this type of shit.

Bottled "Weisse Dark" so Im assuming its the Dunkle. Poured hazy amber with a thick frothy head. Smelled sweet and spicy wheat, caramel, hay, citric, and softly fruity. Flavor was obvious wheat and sweetly citric almost mandarin orange with clove undertones. It was smooth and finished with a clean carbonated bite. I dont usually like Weisse but this one was sessionable.
Nice overall beer.  Pours a hazy tan with a medium head.  I thought it was just OK at first but it reallt grew on more the more I had.

On tap at the Kick Off in Waterloo, University Plaza. Taps your ideal looking Dunkelweisse, hazy brown with a medium light brown head. Aroma is wheat malts with some clove and spice, but nothing too pronounced. Flavour is decent for a style Im not crazy about, very much on the sweeter side of things, which I like, but still mild, some herbal Earthyness to complement the sweet malts but nothing to over powering. Mildly carbonated for the style which is something I can definitely appreciate. I like the mildness of this one, not anywhere near as obnoxioiusly spicy as Paulaner Dunkelweisse, though it does remind me of it. This wouldnt be my first choice in the Hacker-Pschorr line up, but if its my only option from them I wont turn my nose up at it. Glad to have tried it.
Such a go-to beer!  Dark roast, ripe banana, some nutmeg.  Muddy brown, medium haze, dense creamy head.  Soft gritty wheat character, more ripe banana, lingering sweet finish.

Very dark orangeish brown with a finger of smooth light tan head.  Bananas and caramel, light wheat.  Body is prickly carbonation which is distracting.  Taste is light melted caramels, light clove spiciness.

Bügelverschlußflasche. Chestnut-amber coloured, big stable off-white head. Sweet caramelly, almost a bit vinous nose with a sourish-wheaty touch. Moderate sweet-sour flavour, light to medium bodied, soft MF. Lingering mild, slightly chocolatey, mainly caramelly-fruity finish. Good, good Hefeweizen............
Labeled as Weisse Dark. Deep orange body with a decent white head and noticeable carbonation. Aroma and flavor include bits of citrus and malt.
Bottle.  Pours an amber body with a 1 finger white head.  Sweet malty with a nutty bitterness.  Wheaty banana with dusty fruit.  Decent beer.

500 ml.  Don’t know if this is the same beer but it looks close... I have this as a Hacker-Pschorr Weisse Dark, which sounds like a Dunkelweizen to me.  Pours like a cloudy amber belgian, thick off-white head, fruity aroma also reminiscent of a belgian.  Flavor isn’t as overwhelming as a belgian though, in fact seems a little light, watery.  Interesting style, but probably won’t try again.

pours a very cloudy amber-brown with a medium tight off white head.
Aroma is quite sweet and malty, some banana, apple, clove tones.
Flavour is very smooth, good bready malt flavour, wheat crispness, clove spice and light banana towards the end.
From at 500ml bottle purchased at Bottleworks in Seattle--Poured a deep chalky chestnut body with brown tinges.  Malty, smooth, mild with a phenolic yeastiness.  Bready, crisp and clean. Very nice.

Cloudy orange-amber with a great frothy head. Zest yeast and wheat aromas, quite refreshing. General yeastiness rather than any distinct phenolics. Flavor follows the aroma. Yeasty, wheaty, mildly bready, crisp and refreshing.

On tap, pours amber with red highlights, has a tan head.  Smells yeasty and of light wheat.  Taste is creamy and light in carbonation with a nice malt backbone.  Not very much bitterness, but some good spice flavors.  Good stuff.

Date: 09/14/08, 12 oz. bottle
Aroma - Quite fruity, hints of spice, solid caramel character 
Appearance - Cloudy orange/brown pour producing a huge, creamy, and lasting light beige head
Flavor - Sweet malt flavors of caramel, dates, figs dominate. Some wheaty tartness provides the balance, as any hop bitterness is well hidden and very gentle. The finish is very lightly sweet, and that seems to be very appropriate in this beer
Palate - Medium body with vigorous carbonation, very smooth mouthfeel
Overall - Among the better dunkelweizens that I’ve had, very drinkable, tasty, and with enough complexity to be interesting.

Really enjoy this one.  Very light flavor but yet pretty complex.  I taste of clove and bananas.  Very attractive pour, medium brown in color and very hazy.  Good sized quickly diminishing head.  Very easy to drink.

great fruit-wheat aroma

very carbonated, cloudy dark amber, medium light tan head

typical wheat beer mouthfeel-- very nice. distinctive light sweetness to go 
with medium-body wheat, spice, and fruit taste.

Labeled as Hacker-Pschorr Weisse Dark.  Pours with a hazy brown body and a large, creamy white head with good lacing and retention. Aroma of bananas, caramel and some chalk and clove. Taste is water, toffee and rotten bananas, a bit too fizzy.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2008 Murky Brown with good sized off white head.  Aroma of roasted malt and caramel.  Light palate. Lively carbonation.  Flavor of caramel, hints of banana and spice. Not a bad beer.  Pretty smooth.
bottle, almond color, thin head, nut brown color, flavor is slightly banana with caramel overtones, finish is watery

A very nice looking dark amber color with thin white head that lasted until the last swallow.  Aroma had hints of something sweet, which I guess could be described as clovey malt (ie, commerical description).  Flavor was altogether what one would expect from a weiss beer: non-bitter, easy to pound.  The finish was thin but noticeable, one-dimensional but solid, true to the German tradition.  This is a beer that meets all expectation and would completely satisfy most every palette.  Just a little boring in a market jam-packed with originals.

12 oz. bottle from Wine Warehouse, labeled Weisse Dark. Produced 1/08. Very hazy brown color with a big head. Spicy aroma with some wheat and banana notes. Very yeasty taste with notes of banana, caramel, bread and spice. A little sharp in taste, but very pleasant.

Bottle. Dark cloudy amber with a big, slowly-diminishing, beige head. Nice aroma of fruity and spicy esters, maybe some light citrusy hints and caramel. Sweetish flavor, slightly tart, with some caramelly and a bit bready malt, light banana notes and some hints of apples. Medium-bodied with a typical Weizen mouthfeel.

12 oz bottle-Cloudy amber color w/a big tan head. Sweet, roasted malt aroma. Weak malt flavor, yeast, bread dough, roasted malt, blah, blah, blah. Pretty boring; thin watery mouthfeel. Seems overrated to me
Tap - pours dark orangy red colour.  Large off white head.  The aroma is fragrant and malty and the flavor is sweet and a bit of coffee like and  a bit of spice.  Nice beer overall...
Bottle.  Pours dark, has a darkih head.  Aroma is a bit fruity.  Nice, not as good as the hefe.

Pours a hazy dark brown color, but light enough to see the white bubbles flowing up to the white head.  Aroma is fragrant... floral, yeasty, and a bit of sweetness.  Flavor is yeast, a little sugary sweetness, and spice.

12 oz. bottle.

Hazy, deep amber appearance with a fairly large, off white head and modest lacing.  Yeasty aroma complimented by caramel malt, banana and spices.  Fruity, moderately sweet, earthy taste, well carbonated, with the smoothness that is typically associated with wheaty brews.  Just a hint of sourness in the aftertaste.

I found this to be a pleasing dunkel weisse.... but hell, I enjoy almost all dunkel weisse beers. This one still gived you the clove and banana taste but you get something extra.... A good caramel malt flavor and some of the hop bitterness. This is good stuff.
brown pour with average beige head, very sweet candy-like aroma and of course wheat, the flavor slightly burnt sweetness with spice and banana showing up front overall very smooth though.

On tap, pours dark brown/copper with a soft white head. Not much clove or sweetness up front, more along the hefe side with heavy banana flavor, heavy wheat, thick body. Very enjoyable beer, but very mild in the dunkle character.

Bottled, Der Pschorr, Munich. Right, I didnt want or order this, but Im glad I did because its a beauty. Muddy orange pour heaped with thick pillows of froth. Ravishing snout with banana, pepper, clove, slightly farty malt nuttiness. Thats at least an 8. Palate milky but prickling with spritz. Ripe banana rolled in white pepper and almond. BOTTSF? A swill of clovey mouthwashy spice. Edging towards dunkelweizen perfection.

Draft at the Flying Saucer in San Antonio. Pour is a medium brown with a light white head. Smell is slightly spicy, slight sweet. Taste is smooth malt, light, not too sweet, a bit off burnt malt taste and no speakable hop flavor. Not bad but seemed better when I lived in Germany.

Called "dark wheat" on the bottle. Pours cloudy "brown" brown.  Well behaved pour, 3/4" off-white head. Smells like dark wheat malt, and very bitter hops. I was expecting this one to taste a little overbearing like most dunkelweizens, but was pleasantly surprised when it came up tasting more like a hefeweisebier hell. The flavor is light and refreshing and of good quality wheat malt, slight banana, vanilla, and citrus notes. Its starts with a lot of carbonation and smooths out as it goes down. Pleasant, clean finish.
Tap: Cloudy light brown color with a strong malty aroma of sweet alcohol.  Lots of sweet flavors abound - candy and cola mainly.  Pretty good.

Has a very typical wheat beer nose; lots of bananas and cloves, but a nice cloudy brown color.  Minimal but long lasting head.  Good lacing.

Flavor is very much the fruity, banana wheat beer.  Thankfully not much of the bubblegum flavor you get with some wheats.  Very nice beer.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2008 Bottle from Bev4Less. Dark brownish/amber in color. Sizable foamy head. Some floaters. Somewhat sweet spicy aroma. Some banana and clove. Mildly sweet spicy flavor. Fairly yeasty. Roasty malt finish. Pretty tasty.

(355 ml bottle ("produced on 08/07") from <A HREF=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/massachusetts/w target=blank>Julios Liquors) Pours cloudy brownish amber with a tall biege head. Aroma of banana, brown sugar and clove. Mouthfeel is medium-full and smooth. Flavor is sweetish banana with clove, brown sugar, wheaty malt and a hint of pepper. Nice example of style and an enjoyable beer.

swing top bottle (500ml). -Murky brown coloured, huge beige head, fresh acidic wheaty nose. Mild malty, fruity, yeasty and wheaty taste with notes of caramel and spices. Pleasant and easy-drinkable weizen.

I love dunkels and this one was great.  Why can only the Germans get this style right?  Gorgeous light brown pour with a thick foamy tan head.  Aroma is of cloves and yeasty notes.  Just beautiful.  Tickles the palate with the right amount of malty sweetness.  Might be just the slightest bit too bitter for my expectations of the style.  Overall I loved this one.  Superior brew from a brewer that showed me a wonderful time in Munich last September.
500ml bottle that says Weisse Dark.  Cloudy orange with large creamy head.  Lemony with toasted malts in both smell and taste.  Went down pretty quick, I like.

Draft at Smokeless Joes Toronto. Served in a Hacker beer mug.  medium-brown copper with a nice white head.  Caramel, bubbly and delicious.   Not much extra I could detect, maybe some light spices.  Gassy for me.

bottle .cloudy light brown pour . big white head decent lacing . aroma of wheat ,bananas and toasted malt . flovor of sweet toasted malts with hints of banana and fruit. spicy,tart and dry finish. medium bodied

Sampled at Food and Froth.  Pours not as dark as I thought it would -- looks kinda like a Brown Ale.  Tastes nice and light like a Hefe, without the banana and spice, and instead with a nice malty hint of smokiness.

Bottle. This one appears to be about a year and a half old. Pours cloudy dark copper with medium off white head. Aroma is moderately sweet and caramelly with some citrus zing to it. Flavor is also a touch sweet and caramelly wtih a good wheat character and hints of banana as wells as a ctiric acidity that balances the initial sweet impression. Mildly spicy and clovey, just a hint, with a dry and tartly refreshing finish that is medium in duration. Almost still at first, but then comes with a fair amount of deceptively light carbonation, mouthfeel is not bad but slightly off to me. Overall this is light and refreshing like I find a good wheat but with a malty sweetness that blends fairly well without weighing it down too much. Good beer but I suspect it is not may favorite of the style.

Pours a dark brownish copper into the glass with a nice white head.  Aroma is toasty and  banana-like.  Taste is very smooth and refreshing with some fruitiness at first followed by a bizarre but nice spice.

My bottle is labeled Weisse Dark. Dark and cloudy golden-brown pour with a small white head. Light but pleasant aromas of banana bread, toasted malts, and a hint of bubble gum. Flavor is grainier than expected, with some light fruity esters, a bit of spice, and lots of toasted malts. Palate is medium, semi-sweet, lightly spiced, and slightly watery with some slightly sharp carbonation. Pretty well balanced, but the sharpness throws everything a bit off for me.

Pretty darker brown color that gives it a W-bock look.  Aroma is a powerfully sweet mix of banana, wheat, citrus, clove, and spices.  Flavor is heavy on the banana and fruit sweetness with clove and assorted spices dominating over the wheat.  Not bad, but Im not a huge fan of this one.
I am a fan of Hacker-Pschorr. I like this one, I believe this is the first H-P I have rated but a college buddy loved them and used to make me taste them. would buy again.

text: not all I have heard it could be.  Aroma of spice and grain.  Taste of more spice and some nutty aftertaste.  I have heard that his beer was a real good one buy it wasnt anything exceptional.  May buy again but wouldnt go out of my way.

Pours a clear amber color with a white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, clove, honey, and some herbal notes. Flavor is light malt, wheat, clove, and a peppery bitter finish.

Bottle.  Poured a cloudy, dark hazel with a nice head.  Smelled malty sweet.  For taste, the high level of carbonation makes the first impression.  It also tasted roasty, with some banana.  It had a medium mouthfeel.  A decent beer, not great.
Head hangs around quite a while. Reducing to a layer of bubbles. Strong clove and bananas throughout. Really well done. Would drink it again in a second.
Pours deep amber into a Weizen glass.  Fluffy tan head with good retention recedes leaving slight lacing.  Banana and clove aromas.  Crisp with upfront dark caramel and a lasting clove finish.

(bottle): Pours a dark browv color, somewhat cloudy. Big foamy white head. Somewhat flowery aroma, lots of wheat, dark roasted aroma. Enticing smell. Very bubbly, dark wheat flavor. Some flowers. Very good flavor.

Im sorry but the experts here ar wrong.  80 is far too high a score for the dunkle weisse.  Several German brewers make far superior dark wheats than this.  
Good color and aroma but the fruit taste is too ripe, almost rotten.  Does not finish well.  Youre gonna spend the money for a good German dunkle weisse, look elsewhere.

355 ml. bottle, produced on date in the right hand corner of front label (04/07). Sampled in a Hacker-Pschorr weizen glass that was a thrown in bonus after a beer purchase at Dirty Johns in Iowa City, Iowa.

Poured a cloudy orange hued caramel brown. Active carbonation in the beginning leads to a large creamy, tight foamy head. Takes awhile to dissipate, a smattering of laced sticking.

A nose of bubble gum and banana, fruity esters, lightly sweet toasted malts, touches of caramel and grainy bread. A light herbal hop at the edges.

Smooth medium body, creamy malty crispness, well rounded feel in the palate. Subtle clove, nuts and banana, good weizen yeast flavors. Toasted grain bready malts, a mild fruitiness in the middle, traces of lemons. Soft herbal, tea leaf hops that finish with a dry spiciness. 

An highly quaffable Dunkel Weisse ale, I often find this on sale at stores in my area.

Pours a dark brown which didnt look so appealing until I took a whiff.  Smells like banana bread pudding.  I have not had a lot of dark wheats but this is the best of the bunch for me so far in this style.

Poured from a bottle.  Poured an amber/brown color with a moderate white head.  Hefeweizen-like aroma.  Malt heavy taste with hints of spice and wheat.  Nice.  Drank before I was really into craft beer, and I thought it was awesome.  Quite good, but not as good as I thought back then.

On draft at the Flying Saucer.  Deep amber body with ample white head.  Has an aroma of clove, banana and spice.  Taste mirrors the nose but with a characteristic German Munich note (rich and malty) as well as some very light chocolate notes.  Finishes dry and a little overcarbonated.

Had this beer on 3/27/2001.  Aroma is a mild hefy scent.  Color is a cloudy brown with good carbonation and head.  Taste very good.  Starting with a medium body it goes down with a craemy feel.  Finish is a very lightly roasted flavor backed by a mild hefy flavor.
0.5 l bottle. Hazy brown color. Banana, toffee and fruit in the aroma. Spicy rye, clove, banana and graininess in the flavor. Fresh, decent dunkelweizen.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2009 355 ml, bottled 04-06? Cloudy copper-brown with a medium and somewhat lasting head. Aroma is Bananas Foster lite, with some clove. I dont remember the draft version being this good; maybe it needs over a year of aging???!

I had to pour like three times just to get it to fit into my glass. The taste was typical sweet dunkle taste (which Im not fond of) maybe a tad on the thin side (which, if you arent a big fan of style isnt a bad thing). Got a little better as it warmed.
Thin off-white head and mud and rose color.  Carmel and clove bouquet.  Strong yeasty flavor with hints of caramel and dough.  Decent palate.

My bottle was labeled Weisse Dark.  I wonder how old it is.  

Pour is a muddy orange-brown with a thin head of white froth. Aroma is sweet, cloves and some banana. Similar to the Julius Echter I had just before, but the flavors dont seem as fresh. Still quite tasty.
(Draught (?) at Altes Hackerhaus, München) Clear dark orange to brown color. Fluffy white head. Estery and spicy banana taste. Weak estery banana scent. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.

35.5 cL bottle. Aroma of clove with underlying banane. Slightly hazy copper color with a head thats fine bubble and humongous. A bit thin bodied. Clove start with banana following strongly. There is a slight caramel malt sweetness. The finish is clove and banana. Good stuff.

Poured a nice amber from a 500ml bottle.  Two fingers of off-white head.  Looks kind of like a cloudy iced tea.  Aroma is clove and banana.  Taste is clove and slight banana.  Very mild.  I cuold drink several of these on a hot day, but nothing special really.

Draught at "Steak Frites" NYC.  Had with a sauteed monkfish with a raspberry sauce....a result of my amateurish attempt at beer-food pairing (though it basically worked out fairly well I thought).  Amber/brown color w/ a frothy head and a mild yeasty (banana/clove) aroma.  Dark quickbread to cookie malt flavor with some more banana yeast and underlying appley (even cidery) tartness.  Moderate carbonation in a medium body.  Pretty good when all was said and done.

From my notes 6/7/07 - Pours a two-finger off-white head that fades slowly to a thin layer leaving some lace. Cloudy amber color.  Yeasty/raisin nose.  Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied. Flavor is yeasty and bready, clean finish. 2.90 ($3.97) for a 0.5L glass on-tap from Cafe 7 Numero Heidelberg, Germany.

Bottle pour into a weizen glass. Thick, white head fades quickly with minimal lacing. Misty amber color. Nose is fruity with just a whiff of spice. The body could be just a touch heavier, but its pretty close for this style. The finish is fairly tart, which doesnt seem to suit a dunkel well. Its good, and close to being very good.
Pours brown with a medium head. Lots of caramel and fruit in the aroma. Flavor is dry and well carbonated. Not bad beer.

Draft at Die Bierstube. Pours deep cloudy golden brown, murky in the wide part of the glass. Thin but dense and moussy white head. Spotty lace. Fruity cherry bacony nose--all those notes are right there on the mid-palate as well. Nice tingly carb and almost-grainy body. Rich but totally clean and drinkable, not heavy or cloying.

Rated 11/17/06:  Nice blend of mellow wheat and caramel malt with mild banana and spices. Rather good brew. Nice copper/amber pour clouded with the swirled yeast from the bottom of the bottle, big thick head and moderate lacing. Mouthfeel is a touch thin and watery which sure detracts from the nice aroma and very good flavor.

Huge off white head.  Great aroma.  Flavor starts off pretty straight forward, but blossoms with plum and sweet wheat, making a great balanced brew.  Everything works together well.  I will definitely do this one again.

Nice yeasty aroma with some spice tones. Orangey-brown cloudy colour with big just off-white head that keeps on going. Full complex flavour with yeastiness, some banana, big cloves and other spices (nutmeg?), caramel with a good alcohol finish. Somewhat sweet. Good weight in the mouth and slides down smoothly.

500ml bottle (The Gallows Bird, Espoo).
Toffee and banana nose - full bodied. Urweisse without the alcohol, both bitter and malty in the mouth. Very smooth and fresh, but also sweet enough to be your desert.

12 oz bottle, 06.06.  Label reads Weisse Dark. Cloudy amber with active carb.  Big, off-white head.  Zesty wheat nose; spiced prune, some clover.  Mushy bananas, bubblegum with a hint of caramel and cloves.  Tart crabapple finish helps cut a thin, pasty body.

Bottled (BB 11/2007)
Hazy dark amber color, big cloudy and creamy brownish head. Very fruity banana aroma. Slightly sweetish, watery and thin mouthfeel. A bit roasty notes but overall not very fruity-yeasty flavor. Refreshing dunkelweizen, but lacks the depth of the best ones its style.

Dark brown colored, strongly cloudy appearance. Medium sized light brown head. Nice banana and grains in aroma, even mild chocolate there. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is somehow watery with grainy banana, yeast and mild spices. Nice aroma, flavor could be stronger. Somehow round aftertaste.

(Bottled) Murky darkish brown with a small head. A bit dull, slightly roasty aroma with mild roastiness. Bready, banana-fruity flavor with some sweetish-roasty malt. Medium-bodied palate with balanced carbonation. Balanced and very easily drinkable, but nothing really special.

A pretty on-par dunkleweizen with lots of esters on the nose and tongue. doesnt really pair well with a cigar. it gives it some type of cherry taste.  nevertheless, you cant go wrong with a dunkleweizen on the first 80 degree day of the year.

Bottle, pours with a great, fluffy head, as any good weizen will. Aroma very nice, with strong clove notes, mild banana (my least favorite thing about weizens), and a nice bit of earthiness from the dark malt. Flavor matches the aroma note-for-note. Palate is lively, with high carbonation. I really enjoy this beer, much more than I like the typical hellweizen.

Crisp and clean with no attitude. That can be a good and bad thing.Pour was a light brown with 1 finger head. Aroma was of malt. Taste was roasted malt with a wheat-y kick and carbonation.Good middle of the road beer.

text: Pours a wonderful earthy brown color, cloudy, short-lasting head.  Nice pungent smokiness to the aroma, also some hay, toast, cloves.  On the meatier side of the aroma, rather than fruity.  The taste brings a bit more fruit though.  Tart citrus and toasty flavor, some slight oranges in the back of the throat.  Dry finish thats very mellow.  Mouthfeel was not as carbonated and a bit slicker than expected.  Good bready taste, but more tart than expected.  Are dunkelweizens supposed to be fruitier?  Anyway, this was pretty decent, but I might like normal hefe better.

Pours a cloudy dirty brown.  Nice nose of banana, sweet malt, a biscuity sweetness, and a nice touch of spice.  Great medium carbonation with a good dose of banana bread like sweetness as well as an earthy biscuity flavor, as well as a good German estery spiciness.  A great underappreciated beer.

text: Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a pint glass, cloudy brown with a thick tan head and a fair amount of floaters. The aroma was a big dose of malt with a touch of citrus. The flavor was of wheat and sweet malt with notes of fruit and citrus. Very smooth with little or no bitterness. A solid session beer.

Poured a very cloudy light brown after I swirled and poured the remaining yeast into the glass. The head was soapy and three fingers thick in my weisse glass and never really went away. The nose was of wheat, baked bread and banana. The taste started with bananna, bread, raisins and apples. The end was malty and yeasty with the slightest hint of clove. The finish was smooth and oily with a medium feel. This was a nice, above average representation of the style. Well worth trying

Bottle, weizen glass. Pours a nice dark tan, plenty of head, quite a bit of esters, plenty of banana and clove, a bit of spice too. Taste is fairly sweet its nicely done, decent malt undertones, hops are not present as is usually in german wheat beers. Quite nice I think I prefer it to its better known lighter cousin.

A slightly hazed pour with a mucho tan head. A good aroma of what seems to be corriander and other spices. A flavor of sweet light maltiness with a touch of light bitter. A palate that is surprisingly more full than I expected. A better beer than i expected. A tad more complicated than I really thought it would be.

Bottle. Hazy copper brown with a decent light beige head. Classic yeasty spicy weizen aroma with a touch of sourness. Flavors of cloves, bananas, and fruity caramel malts with a sweet, full mouthfeel- then a sour dry finish shuts it down and keeps it refreshing. Good beer.
Dark brown color. Strong wheat beer with amber notes. Tates like a wheat beer but with a lot more character. Unique and drinkable. Great Beer.
