dark brown color, sharp taste at start but gets better every sip, a good dark wheat beer that is quite well rounded, and it has a great head to match, quite enjoyable. I want to try more by this brewer.

on tap at smokeless joes. lotsa head, citrus yeast nose some clove. lotsa wheat flavour enjoyed this one all spring

Bottled. Amber coloured. Unclear. Dense dark beige head. Yeast, banana, light citrus and light spice in the aroma. Flavour as well has all the good wheaty notes. Citrus, banana and yeast. Nice balance. Is acidic and dry. Medium bodied. Is cleansing and fresh. Very good one in my book.

Draught @ beerbistro, Toronto: My first draught sample at beerbistro, sounded like my kind of thing.  Poured a bright orange-brown with a good foam head on it.  Aroma of caramel-sweet malt with yeast and citrus fruit, precisely what I was hoping for.  Taste is perhaps milder than youd expect but very well assembled and balanced.  Great sweetness, not overly carbonated, with generous amounts of citrus, banana, and clove.  Great stuff.

draught:  bours dark brown, but it was not the best pour by the bartender.  the head was minimal.  Aroma was of sweet malt, slightly spicy with banana mixed in there.  Flavor are a mirror of the aroma.  Crisp however.  medium body.  Not overly heavy.
Very good dunkelweizen with light wheat and banana flavors.  Very smooth, slightly roasted flavor.  Good carbonation.  Sweet up front and on the finish.  Thick and chewy mouthfeel.  Very enjoyable.
Nice Hefe aroma with hints of fruit and banana. A bit of malty backbone under an essentially very refeshing Weizen. A bit light palate however that is the intention.

12 oz bottle via trade with RegallacMC (thanks Paul).Pours a hazy copper color with a large foamy head that leaves a lot of chunky lace. Bready aroma with notes of orange, caramel and a bit of alcohol. Thin mouthfeel.Sweet wheat flavor with a crisp semi-dry finish and a bit of a fleeting wheat & bananna in the aftertaste.

bottle.  Aroma:  Caramel, toasted malt, vanilla, slight banana and a hint of nectarine.  Appearance:  Dark amber in color and slightly hazed.  Head was light beige, full, and mousselike.  Head lasted almost to the end of the glass.  Nice lacing.  Flavor:  A subtle bready flavor, caramel, vanilla, and a touch of bubblegum.  Banana and clove more prevalent in the flavor than the aroma.  Flavor is pretty sweet right until the finish where a light sourness comes in.  Palate:  Medium bodied with a somewhat creamy texture.  High carbonation.  Finish was clean and had a slight crispness.  Overall:  This is a decent dunkelweizen that hits all the expected flavors.  Could have had a little more banana/clove in the flavor and a little more richness in the mouthfeel.
17oz bottle-pours a light tan head with red color.  Aroma is caramel malt.  Taste is caramel medium malt, minor hops.  Good carbonation.

From a 500 ml bottle.  Poured amber brown with an enormous head that lasted seemingly forever.  Very little nose and what there was a very nice malt, with a hint of sugar, bananas, and vanilla.  Very nice mouthfeel and good flavor.  Very nice to drink.

Murky brown. White head. Aroma is sweet and slightly chocolatey. Hints of brown sugar. No hop aroma noticeable. Taste is malty, creamy, and slightly bitter. Some honey and lots of wheat. Pretty smooth, and rather interesting. I like it. The dunkelweisse needs to be explored more.

"Ho hum to higher then. Poured a brown amber color with a massive head, bartender had trouble with this one. Aroma was yeasty with some spice to it. Flavor was a little to sweet for my liking in this style. Also some fruits in here, some apples? or banana? not sure. Mouthfeel was a little thin. "
Off white creamy head with medium to high lacing. Dark tan in color.  Nice appearance.  Metalic task and light bodied.Not much flavor, Better looking.
Bottle. Creamy white excellent mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Powerfull hoppy and yesty aroma. Moderate malty aswell. Nice bitter/acetic flavor. Average finish. A little watery palate. Nice hefe.
A fine German wheat beer.  Deep amber colour with a fair head.  Slight clove taste and yeasty overtones add substantial character to this ale.

This is my first Dunkel Weisse.  Not much aroma initial as it was served waaaay too cold and with a lemon slice.  Why do people that know little about beer think that ALL weisse beers should have a slice of lemon.  Anyway, there was a slight malt aroma.  Not as wheaty as I wouldve expected.  This is, however, a medium to full body brew.  I can see myself drinking this on a cool fall day with some game.
Highly crisp and refreshing weiss bock.  Good kick and full nose of caramel and oats.  A bit too sweet at the end, but still recommended, obviously.
Pours a hazy amber color with a decent head.  Has a sweet bready aroma.  Nice.  Flavor is sweet and  malty.  No heavy banana.  Light to medium body.  A very nice beer.
Gold appearance- thick head fairly long lasting, tiny bubbles- bananas, vanilla and honey nose  bright taste that mirrors its nose  fresh short aftertastes

Tap at Chaucers Pub, London, Ontario- Pours deep brown/orange with tons of haze, and a thick and foamy white cream. Mildly citric aroma, some clove, and very yeasty. Taste is again, yeasty, sweet fruit, corriander and citrus rinds. Mint sprigs too! Smooth and creamy. Very drinkable!
Orange-brown with a medium head. Aroma of banana bread and caramel. A bit of a sweet spicy flavor. Can notice some carbonation.

On tap at Alex P. Keaton (London, ON). Cloudy brown body topped with an average off-white foamy head. Good malty/hoppy aroma with yeasty and spicy notes. Taste is very well balanced. It has a mild texture and is slightly dominated by maltiness. Ends with a decent bittersweet finish.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2006 Bottle sampled with Stegosaurus. Pours orange brown with a decent off-white head. Aroma of wheat, bananas, and caramel. Flavor is sweet, slightly carbonated, banana, good mouth feel.
an orange brown beer with a medium sized off white head.  sweet toffee and banana bread aroma.  flavors of banana but the darker malts dont really show through.  middle of the road.
cloudy brown colour.  flavour is heavy, wheaty.  banana detectable.  carbonation coarse.  difficult to get down at times due to carbonation.
Cloudy brown yellow.  Cloves, wheat, banana bread, and dryness.  A dark yeast sediment pocket at the bottom with a lively carbonation.   Hacker-Pshorr is one of Germanys finest.

Draught at Smokeless Joe. Very hazy golden-brown colour with a moderate head. Aroma is yeasty with notes of clove and a slightly soapy quality. Flavour is bang on for the style - notes of banana, clove, sweet malt & yeast. Mouthfeel is light, and the finish is quite short. Not my favourite, but not too bad.

Bottle.  Pours a slightly cloudy medium brown with orange highlights.  Big, fluffy off-white head that lasts all the way down. Mildly spicey aroma with a hint of clove.  Slightly sweet initial taste against a good malty base.  Yes, theres a hint of clove in the background.  Flavors were more sublte than I had expected but its still a nice, smooth beer.  Wish I had another.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange amber with a nice thick white head. Fruity banana clove esters in the aroma. Flavor of fruit candy, banana, clove,  dark wheat malt, and caramel. Sweet and refreshing finish. A nicely done Dunkle.
Pours translucent orange amber with thin off-white head.  Aroma of wheat, malt and wet leaves with a rye bread and clove flavor.

Tap at Auslander  Pours a watery tea-brown.  Aroma is malty molasses.   Flavor is clove and bubblegum, with highlights of molasses.  Palate will do, Pig.  Itll do.  Refreshing; lite for the style.  The bartender, Rebecca, is a hottie.  Nice conversation with her.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Pours brown with an orange hue, there is a bubbly white head that fades to a thin whisp.  Smells sweet like apples, candy, and there is also some malty wheat in there.  I taste the dark malt and wheat but then underneath it all I picked up on some banana.  It left a strange taste in my mouth.

I picked a 6-pack up and was worried that i had already tried this before and didnt like it but was i ever relieved to see i hadnt any words to say about on Ratebeer.com. Enjoyable aroma of sweet malt and bubblegum with a slight hint of banana which i found kind of odd since it is a dunkelweizen. Flavor is a little sour and bitter with a small background of wheat and lightly toasted malt. After gulping few drinks i licked my lips and had a lot of sweet sugary residue which is real good and has me licking my lips even more. Color is a tea colored brown with a firm foamy head. This dunkel is both decent and quaffable.

Amber, honey brown in color. Full weisse nose. Medium nectar with no medicinal flavors, damn! I want medicine. This seems to be the signature here with old Hacker-slag.....no medicine. Ahhh farg off will ya ! I would have given it a perfect score if she were even slightly medicinal. Oh well, its a great specimen just of a different character. Well ballanced with a nice smooth finish.  Highly recommended.

Draft @ Smokeless. Very murky brown body with a small white head and decent lacing. (3+) Yeasty aroma, sour-tart wheaty tang, touch of malt. Flavour has the same sour-tart wheat bite, yeasty with fruity esters, banana, ephemeral hings of clove/spice is barely there. Touch simplistic at times but really hit the spot today. Medium to full bodied. Tasty.

Draught at Smokeless Joe. Pours a very murky orange-brown with a small diminishing off-white head. Nice lacing. Aroma of banana, apple, spices, wheat and a touch of caramel malt. Flavour of malt, brown sugar, spices, banana and apple with a slightly sour finish. Light bodied and somewhat flat tasting. Somewhat bland but decent enough, Id probably enjoy it more on a patio in the summer.
Tasty - not as strong in flavor as youd think for a dunkel.  If you can find this tasty treat you should definitely try one :)  Hints of chocolate - maybe caramel with a dry finish
Cloudy, medium amber with a huge rusty-tan head that recedes very slowly. Caramelly banana aroma, the flavor shows malt with the banana coming through again.

Bottle. Pours rust-colored with beige head. The aroma is burnt caramel, banana, and leaves. The flavor is quite grainy, with some sugary malt, wet grass, banana, and a somewhat flat dry finish. I didnt care for this as much as other people apparently did, but its ok.

500 mL bottle. Pretty dark amber with a big frothy head.  Aroma of banana, bubblegum, and clove.  Flavor was the same with a medium mouthfeel and a good sweet finish.  Awesome dunkel.  I would love to try this fresh on tap in Munich.
Light brown, cloudy.  Delicate and smooth.  Flavors of banana and light clove.  Easy to drink.  Not bad at all.

Bottle poured a hazy brwn with a large, lasting off white head. Aromas of clove, wheat, and a hint of banana. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of clove, wheat, and a hint of citrus and banana with a smooth, slightly sweet finish.
Draft. Poured a hazy dark amber with an average creamy off-white head that was lasting. Moderate wheat citrus aroma. Medium body. Moderate sweet, light bitter flavor with an average finish.
What a delicious beer!  Very fruity flavors and aromas.  Orange, bananas and lemon was detected as was some yeast.  Wonderful!

Bottle.  Molasses malt and banana-peach aroma - very nice.  Cloudy orange-brown with moderate head.  MIld sweet-sour malt and banana/apple flavor.  A bit on the weak side.  Would have gotten a near perfect score if it had a stronger dark malt flavor.  Probably much better fresh.  Still along with Franziskaner, the best German dunkelweizen youll find in the states.  This rating in memory of Dortmunder - a great rater.  You will be missed.
Hazy orange with off-white head.  Yeast, apple, banana aroma gives way to malty caramel and banana palate and a delicate taste of hops in the finish.  Ahh the subtlety of German beer.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2005 Tons of carbonation.  Nice roasted taste with some spicy clove notes and  hint of banana in the finish for me.  Nice satisfying wheat taste.  This is a beer I could drink a lot of.  A nice session beer.  Taste is enough to be plesant, but not so much that you can only drink one of these beers at a time.

Pours light brown and cloudy with a foamy off-white head.  Aroma of banana, bubble gum, and clove.  Taste is nutty caramel, dusty yeast, and smooth wheat.  Medium bodied with lush carbonation and mouthfeel.  Quite delicious.

draught. deep murky brown-copper with a fluffy white head. nice weizen aroma - full of spicy clove, banana fruitiness, and chalky yeast. soft fruit body with caramel sweetness. quenching and somewhat similar to their normal weizen.  slightly watery in the finish. still pretty good though.

Draught.  At BeerBistro.  Poured murky orange-brown with a decent tight foamy white head.  Initially smelled a tad "ur-ine-al", but settled to buckwheat honey with some roasty malt - not quite beer-like, I was looking around for some toast.  Taste was clean dark honey with grain and roasty malt - very simple and pleasant.  A little flat and sugary mouthfeel - overall quite nice but the sweetness built up a little too much - finished with some nice ripe apple tones.
Pours a brown color.  Aroma of your normal hefe but with a bit of maple or nutty smell.   Tastes much the same with a slight roasted taste to it.  Pretty decent.

Pours brown, though not as cloudy as the other dunkelweizens I sampled the same night.  Smells of brown sugar, but the other spicey aromas which made the other two so distinct are lacking here.  Taste is more bitter and peppery with some decent banana and clove notes.  A little watery on the mouthfeel.

I love wheat beers and Hacker-Pschorr makes some of the best. This is a crisp clean and refreshing beer.  Definitely something to drink repeatedly.  Easy to find (at least here) and worth looking for.  Nice head, hazy weisse you would expect.  Good stuff.

On tap, Smokeless Joes.  Hazy light brown appearance, small white head.  Spicy mild aroma.  Light bubbly mouthfeel.  Taste is sweet, brown sugar like, with a hint of spiciness.  Pretty bland really but flavourful enough to make it drinkable.  Not bad.
On draft at the Cock and Bull.  Smelled like sweet bananas.  Poured hazy brown.  Tasted sweet citrus and banana.  A hint of chocolate.

Pours murky copper brown with a big tan lacing head. Nose of apple bread, and lots of wheat. Biscuity with lots of citrus and wheat grass. Lots of carbonation. Some brown sugar and the slightest trace of cocoa and plum. Its alright.

this beer is a classic weisse beer of the dunkel variety.  it is slightly effervescent with a lingering taste!  it is copper brown in color and has a semi-sweet aroma about it.  all in all a nice dunkel weisse.

500 bottle. orange-brown with a cream colored head that clings to the glass. smells of banana and cloves. smooth with fruit notes, high carbonation and low acidity, but little watery. is rather flavorless when cold, tasted better once it warmed up a little. overall a decent beer that lack complexity.
Weisse-Dark, 500ml Bottle. Pours a orangish brown with a nice lingering off-white head. Aroma of sweet bannana and malt. Taste is sweet, with a very light palate. A nice drink.
user_location: Waco (Buckle of the Bible Belt), Texas, USA

text: Pours a brown color w/ a nice tan head and some ok lacing.  Smells of bannanna, clove and wheat.  Palate is fairly basic ok coating a little thin.  Flavor was good for a macro if you would.. a wheat and light carmel flavor w/ bannannas.  Decent stuff.

Dark brownish-orangepour with a good sized head.  Smells similar to the Hefeweizen.  Fruity with a taste of spiced cookies, cloves, bananas.  Good as a easier to find german export.  Worth a try If they have it at your local beer store or pub.
Decent, but left alot on the table.  Its a nice dark wheat, not to complex.  I would more than likely reach for something else.

Rich sweet malty nose. Brown sugar and bananas, clove and allspice. Mild carbonic-hoppy tang. Gingerbread dough. Mahoghany or chestnut in color, cloudy with small dark chunks floating beneath an off-white foamy lacing head. Medium watery body with heavy carbonation. Starts with a carbonic tang from the heavy carbonation, a distraction. After that subsides, the more mellow sweet maltiness comes out. Notes of brown sugar, gingerbread and banana. Watery overall, with a bit of fruity hops. Finish is mildly bitter, but more from the carbonation aspect than of strong hops. After has mellow malty sweetness and banana. A decent dunkelweizen, but I think next time Id like to have it by the liter in München.

Pours  a hazy light brown-dark orange color with a huge amount foamy white head.  Beware when pouring because it really bubbles up.  Aroma is delicious! Sweet yeasts, rich caramel chocolate, sugared fruits and brown sugar.  Flavor is a little of a let down after the aroma: starts with a very bold clove, spice taste, followed by a slightly sweet dry finish.  Overall, not a bad brew.

This beer is bottle conditioned so pour carefully. It pours a copper-brown color with a small off-white smooth head that lasts for a little while and left some lacing on the glass. The aroma was malty with a strong presence of fruit, notably banana and notes of spice. It had a medium body with a clean, thin texture and fizzy carbonation. The taste starts with a good malty flavor. The fruits and spiciness come out in the middle and the finish is long with hints of banana.
UPDATED: MAR 29, 2006 Pours orange brown with a decent off-white head. Aroma of wheat, bananas, and caramel. Flavor is sweet, slightly carbonated, banana, good mouth feel. Good body, Great brew.

Sweet bready aroma, with light lemon and dusty caramel in the background. Appearance is a nice murky burnt-sienna. Flavors is nice and refreshing with a good dose of some light almond, on top of the fantastic wheat and sugars. Not too shabby.
Creamy smooth, sharp wheat and cocoa prominent in nose, medium mouthfeel. Frothy head and some lace. Some cinnamon spice and banana and mostly malts.
Daft; amber in color with a average sized, white, frothy head. Some lacing.Very hazy. Hints of citrus in the aroma and flavor department. Some spicy after taste. Light to medium creamy beer. Not bad!

Ive had terrible versions of this beer... usually oxidized bottles that have been in ship/warehouse too long.  However, fortunate enough to have tried Hacker-Pschorr Dunkle Weisse at the Hacker Haus in Munich.  It was THE very best Ive ever tried.  We couldnt stop ordering them.  The balance and freshness was outstanding.  Prosit!

Bottle. Clear light brown with a large beige head that faded quickly and left only smears of lacing. Smell and taste are the same with this beer: namely Wheatena cereal, slightly burned wheat toast and allspice. Thin, slightly overcarbonated body. Drinkable, but thats about it.
Pours flat, dull and llifeless.  Aroma is mild and paper-like.  Flavor has some roast and some nuttiness, but nothing that is memorable.  Finish is sweet, but thin.

Poured dark amber with a large fizzy off-white head.  Aroma of banana, cloves, and a touch of bubble gum.  Taste is sweet banana with some slight hops, with a touch of malty richness.  Body feels somewhat thin.  Overall a drinkable but uninteresting brew.
Less okay than the Leichte Weisse.  Dull and disappointing.  Same biergarten with aforementioned seafood pizza.

Hazy and amber with a light brown head. Tart aroma of caramel, banana, clove, a little earth. Medium bodied with low bitterness and a quick finish. Very mild in flavor with spicy caramel and some chalkiness. Not bad but the flavors could be punched up.

Draft,Hazy brown with a thick white head.Nice spicy aroma clove and some banana notes.Rich caramel taste that is also faintly clovey and lots of wheat character,Not much on the hops. Medium body and fairly bubbly.
Very Smooth

12 oz bottle.  Faint yeasty clouds static in a translucent brass body, thick fluffy head...earthy, caramel-banana nose seems to show a bit of staleness...dried caramel in the fairly plain if quaffable body, dry all the way through, bit cardboardy late.  I suspect this bottle was just a touch over the hill...
Bottle. tasty and delicious. enjoyed this. Great dark brew. good fruity aroma and smooth finish.
Bottle. A tasty beer, mildly sweet, aromatic, clean and palatable. I really enjoyed it, though Im partial to dark wheat beers.

I believe that maybe this beer was just a bad bunch, perhaps.  It smelled like rotten apples and it actually tasted somewhat like that too - delicious (apples, that is).  Had a certain light airiness for a dark.

Enjoyed at Macs Bar while watching the Flamingogos in Lansing Mich...Dark cloudy amber nut brown hue... Has a typical hacker Pschorr flavour but sweeter Malty aroma sweet flavour light hop bitter on side of tongue light beige head...
Okay dunkel.  Im not a fan of the style, so I dont think I should say much.   Pretty much no aroma, none of the banana.  I just never get the banana!

I had this beer on tap for the first time and it was very good.  The bottled variety lacks a little in taste and appearance, but it is still a good dunkel.  Cloudy, moderate head, a good beer on a cold winter night.
bottle.  poured a dark cloudy amber with an exceptional head and great lacing.  light to medium body with a bit of spice or tanginess on the finish.  a good but not great dunlek.

This was my virgin voyage in the dunkle weiss category several years ago.  I was like, "It comes in dark colors too?"  The best way I can describe it is as a hefe with more malt and sweetness - more rich, almost what you would get by crossing a dopple bock with a hefe.  Recommended for the experience, if nothing else, but Im not behind this brew 100% and would like to see what else is out there in the category and how they compare.
Dark amber color with a medium head.  Banana and wheat aroma.  Very sweet malty taste.  Not much depth, but very tasty.
Pours a beautiful amber. Long lasting beige head. Not much going on here . Weak malt taste for a dunkle. Very slight banana taste.
Orange/Brown Coloring. Off White Head. Malty,  Fruity...Coriander... Sweet... Not My Favorite Hacker-Pschorr, But a Decent One.

Why does the dude on the label always look so serious - its just beer!  This dunkel starts off tart and tangy, banana and cinnamon and then the clove......yeah.  As I sipped at it, I kept thinking of candy.....what candy does it remind me of.....?????  Finally it dawned on me - this tastes like those rootbeer barrel candies - that herbal spicy sweet taste.  This is a really good dunkel!

Was none the wise until I tried. Very pleasantly surprised.  Havent learned to distinguish aroma yet, overall nice aroma. I catch the clovey taste.  Nice full brown body with decent head.  Somewhat creamy texture and great overall finish, clean and neat. First try for me. Will drink again me thinks. The same as Weisse Dark?

Thcik murly brown color wirth a thin head on top.  Aroma is mostly malty nuttish scent, but there is an odd smell like canned pasta.  Flavor is a similar malty ness with an bit of odd flavor to it, and a decent bitterness on the closing side.
bottled. pretty rame dunkelweizen. brown and murky with a decent head. burnt banana and caramel aroma. slight hint of whiteboard markers, medium sweetness, okay, i guess

Draft at the Hotel Leiner in Garmisch-Partenkirchen Germany. Off-white head, good lacing, fast rising carbonation, cloudy appearance with a brown hue. Malty, caramel, banana and clove aroma. Malty and caramel flavor and some spicyness. Smooth and somewhat thin palate. Light bodied beer.

I was pleasantly surprised to see this and its lighter sibling at a store in Salem.
Quite a distinguished looking beer, light hazy chesnut brown with a large frothy off white head.
Rather pleasing aroma..the usual germen hefe smells plus a rich maltiness.
Nice taste to this it has the usual esters and spiciness of a regular Hefe and a nice caramel malt sweetness.
Very smooth on the tongue and semi-dry finish.
I found this exceptionally drinkable..I shall be returnin to the store to by a few cases of this stuff.

Appearance: rosy, cloudy, beneath a lush, looming, lovely dollop of a creamy, puddingesque head.
Aroma: creamy, clovey, theres the banana, too, with a whiff of other tropical fruits, sensuous, arousing, inherently likable.
Great grit and grab on the palate with first sip, nice blitz of hops, followed by lush, mellow malt. Great body, long, lingering finish, persistent flavor. Smooth, and very easy on the tongue, Goes down the gullet nice as a dream.
A good dunkel-weisse is a wonderful thing, and Hackers is a sterling example.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2005 Pours a cloudy, earthy amber in color with a 1/2" creamy head. Aroma is slightly sour malted grain. Flavor is sweet and malty with hints of wheat. Very nice, smooth dunkel with a crisp finish.

The DM & Hotstuffs European Honeymoon trip beer number 59. This draft brew from our hotel in Garmisch-Partenkirchen Germany poured a medium sized head of foamy finely sized off-white colored long lasting bubbles that left behind a carbonated cloudy dark brown colored body.  The aroma was a dark malt yeasty one and the mouth feel was smooth initially with a slight tingle and a thick lingering yeasty finish.  The flavor contained notes of dark malts yeasty and was somewhat flat after a few minutes.

Finally,  The Hacker trifecta!  Its burgundy, and bubbly with a nice floral ester sweet flavour and a smooth palate -- as with all the pschorrs... but its nothing spectacular.  Full bodied and watery really.  Still prefer the hefe to this!
Nice head on this. Murky burgandy color. Dry lager aroma. Nice full body with good malty notes and some estery sweetness. Hints of wheat peeking through.
(tap) dark cloudy wheat with a full palate but a light finish, very drinakble, these dunkels are really starting to grow on me... crisp.
Nice aroma and flavor.  A good dunkel but I cant say its superior though I would definitely buy it again.  Nice.

This is my first dark wheat so take my rating for what it is.
This is an ok beer,but somewhat overatted.I tasted bananna,and it has good maltiness.
This beer has an interesting cloudy brown apearance.
Nice aroma.  Taste is like cinnamon, nutmeg, malt, and copper.  Nice head, overall pretty good, but nothing I will probably ever buy again.

Bottle. Gold honey colored body with a very thick foamy head. Tastes slightly metallic and bananish. Very weird "basic" (in the pH sense) mouthfeel. Feels slimy. Wheaty and kinda sweet. The flavor is not bad, but that metallic taste isnt pleasant.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2011 A solid dunkelweizen. +++Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a medium brown color with a small brown head. The aroma was sweet wheat malt and a hint of lemon. The flavor was dark malt with strong wheat undertones and a bit of sourness. There is not much citrus in the flavor but there is a nice hop presence. Overall I liked this one quite a bit.

Dunkel are the only wheats I enjoy...this one was a light brown color...smelled a little chocolatey...tasted like soap...very very sour and a soapy aftertaste...finish was complex and soapy...did I mention soap?  Not a good example of something yummy...
Dunkel makes everything better.  Nice color and aroma, with lasting flavor, just the right spiciness to make a good finish.
Me likey like me likey dem wheats - goot und spicity and it gives head too.

Hazy, copper body with a thick, tan head.  Interesting spicy, wheat nose with cinnamon, clove, banana, a touch of both chocolate and banana.  The yeast is present, but seems to be more sour than fruity.  The body is exactly what I expected:  thicker than the typical hefeweizen, but not too thick, and not sticky or harsh.  The flavor is reminiscent of the aroma, but with subdued spice and more rounded sweetness.  The wheaty, grainy malt comes through here more so than in the nose.  The finish carries a unique sour element that keeps this from being too one-dimensional.  A more rounded flavor set and a touch more fruitiness would make this world class.

At some point, I rated Franziskaner Dunkel Weiss and scored it absurdedly high.  That rating stands until I try it again, but THIS beer was very, very nice.  Thick banana in yeast, good color and head, hint of clove, touch of syrupy sweetness, wheaty tang, slightly sour finish, balanced.  Drinkable.  Good.

500 mL bottle: orange, autumn coloured body.  Stiff, fluffy head that has good retention.   Bready, buttered toffee, and spiced banana aroma.  Full clove flavour wraps up sweet banana malts, lightly honey hops, and a subtle citrus tang into a tasty package.  Long, sourish finish that is slightly acidic, but pleasant no less.  Solid Dunkel.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2008 [bottle - Great European Beerfest 8, Sharp Edge Tavern - East Liberty, PA] Poured a medium amber color that was slightly hazy. Malty and wheaty aroma with a mix of citrus and other fruits. Good malt taste with a citrus hint and a chewy, biscuity finish. Very well balanced.
Pours turbid light amber.  Aroma of malt, citrus, banana, yeast.  Tastes malty, with hints of banana, citrus, yeast.  Decent complexity.
Cloudy red brownish with nice head and lacing.   Great  clove/banana nose. Kind of chalky finish. Not as much flavor as the nose suggests. Not a great beer but not bad.
Cloudy light brown pour with little to no head. Aroma is yeasty and clove. Flavor is similar to the hefe, with lots of clove and malty. Not as much dark malt flavor as the appearance suggests.

Rusty copper in colour with no head. The nose is lots of yeasty and wheaty with lots of grains. Same goes for the taste, it smells as it tastes. The yeast is just a bit harsh. But, whatever its not that bad I guess.
Copper with almost no head.  Aroma spicy, wheaty, yeasty.  Medium bodied.  Flavor was passable.  Another "lawnmower beer."

This was my first favorite beer. Smells so good. I love sour things: vinegar, pickles, yeasty sourdough. This beer is brilliantly sour. I am big on the olfactory senses. Beer looks watery and is watery but doesnt taste watered down. It simply isnt very cloudy...something I personally like in a wheat beer. On the tounge, it dissipates and is as carbonated as other wheats. Tastes very fruity. Catching hints of apricot and raisin...but really carbonated ones. Aftertaste is dry and refreshing. Good brew. better on tap than in the bottle in my opinion...a rarity from my mouth.
Drink it!!!!
G-rat

Not as flavorful as I thought it would be. Starts off with some nice traditional hefe flavors (sweet, yeasty spices and banana flavors) mixed with some roasted notes, caramel and chocolate, but after a few sips it seems to get more watery in flavor.

i think im developing a taste for this type of beer. but the appearance is still off putting. looks like cloudy bloody urine, and i know what that looks like. but it did pour a nice head. flavor was consistent with the usual banana undertones. maybe too bitter, but the lemon wedge really helps. it does finish sweet though so it is a nice combo in your mouth to start bitter and finish sweet. i can see how people can appreciate this, but its not yet my milieu. but its growing on me. i really want to like this beer.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2004 (draft 10/04) Hazy copper body with long-retaining, creamy beige head.  Aroma is mild/medium sweet, wheat, caramel.  Taste is moderately sweet, wheat, caramel.  Creamy medium body.  Almost seems like it is on nitro. (5/4/6/4/12)

(bottle 4/04) Humungous beige head atop a hazy, light copper body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, lemon.  Taste is mildly sweet, lemon, some caramel.  Light body. (6/3/5/3/11)

This beer poured a murky brown color with a moderate head and left some lacing on the glass.  The aroma was very wheaty/yeasty with some citrus - pretty good aroma for a weiss beer.  The flavor was a smooth blend of citrus and the wheat.  Very enjoyable weiss brew.
From a bottle. Thin, white head that partly went away. Muddy, red color. Slight banana and peach in the light aroma. A little malt and slight cider. Smooth. I wish I could try this on tap.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2005 Brown and cloudy. Large carbonation bubble. Fruity aroma. Tart wheat flavor. Watch for this one on tap. UPDATE: (6/22/05) Had this in the US export version 500 ml bottle today. Great long lasting beige frothy pillow-like head that remains during the entire drink. Same tart flavor, especially with the yeast mixed up and poured into the glass. Slightly on the light side in body, but a very good beverage.

Poured a inviting opaque orange-amber with gargantuan head.  Relatively mellow yeast aroma.  The flavor is surprisingly sweet, vaguely yeast and clove.  Odd metallic finish.  Decent, but not the best I've had.
A brown-amber color with tan head. A very nice Hefeweizen, but not an outstanding one. I think I need to try twice to fully make up my mind.

This amber, cloudy wheat has a nice fruity nose with hints of bitterness.  The initial taste is sweet with highlights of chocolate and fruit.  There is a medium finish that continues the chocolate and fruit beginning.  A little sweet for me, but not bad.
Pours a nice amber, quite cloudy color, with a large, thick and rocky tan head with very little lacing.  Aroma is mostly banana with some spicey notes.  Taste is malty sweet with a crisp finish.
a very fruity aroma. burnt cream head with lasting strenght. Cloudy amber hue and a cider like taste. However the aftertaste leaves a bad mouth feel, which takes it down a few notches.
UPDATED: FEB 13, 2004 The highlight here is the aroma, its striking, yet delicate.  mild notes of banana, clove and a hint of hops.  finishes quite nicely.

I'll admit this needs a few more samplings for accuracy due to the fact that these Weizen beers just don't travel well. Not as good as the best Weihenstephan that I've had, but very similar in flavor and aroma profile. It just tasted like it was a little past it's peak.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2004 Brown.  large head.  Aromas of citrus and banana, better aroma than most hefeweizens.  Very little wheat in the flavor but lots of sweet malt. I would say it was an abby style if I didn't know better.

amber color with a thick frothy white to light beige head. aroma is quite sour and i'm wondering if this is infected as many have said the Moonglow is. has the sour aroma, but the flavor is fairly sweet with banana and spice.
Good fruity dunkle weisse.  Makes a great finish to a round of golf.  Light body and sweet fruitiness balanced by wheat bite and mild hop flavor.  Great refresher.
Deep cloudy brown color with a whitish head. Wheat, banana aroma. Good balance and finish, with a malty kick to it. Overall pretty decent. Had this on tap at the Beer Sellar in Knoxville, TN.
Light brown and cloudy. Big off white head. Clove dominates the nose with a slight, sharp citrus note. Big round flavor, with notes of clove, banana, and citrus. Decent, inexpensive, stand-by.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: Slightly cloudy amber color with minimal head retention. Filled with every wheat quality and then some...bananas, just a touch raisin, grains, and an overwhelmingly cleanliness in the flavor. Great balance and mouthfeel. My favorite weisse bier this last Oktoberfest.

Cloudy syrup brown color with a finger high frothy thick cream colored head that sticks around for a few minutes before crumbling down to a solid skim always present and drippy strings of lace with some minimal stickyness. Secure hefe nose of wheaty toastyness and clove spice with hints of apple skin and banana and some phenolic notes underneath. Taste is a toasted malt forthcoming in a pleasant full softness, playful and fluffy wheatyness with mild spice of clove and small notes of banana and melon husks. Feel is medium bodied with a nice soft fluffyness of nearly full carbonation that floats through the palate with ease and makes for some good drinking.

Wonderful sweet aroma of banana and clove. The pour was incredible, dark brown with a thick creamy head. This is what beer was ment to look like. The flavor is medium boddied with yeasty characteristics and a short malty finish. I'm not a huge fan of Hacker-Pschorr products, but I'd never turn this one away.
Semi-dark. A complex finish with sour notes, a bit too much for some. However, it warms you up with its potency.
I liked it.  I can't remember too much about it, having already consumed several beforehand.  But I remember my rating.
Fairly good dark wheat.  Nice nutty grain aroma with a brown hue.  Decent wheat flavor that finishes slightly bitter.
(Bottle) Pours a medium amber color a small white head.  Descent flavor, but not one of the best from Hacker-Pschorr.

Dark brown color, very large head and tons of lace. Aroma is a very nice combo of yeast and chocolaty malt. Flavor is chocolaty malts with hints of yeast and banana. Finish is slightly citrusy and sour. The flavor is a little weak.
Nice banana and clover aroma and flavor which carries throughout this brew.  Good balance of wheat flavor.  The way a German Weizen should be.
Aroma is candy and bananas. Appearance is a dark amber color. Flavor is wheat, bananas, and grapes. Its has a rather spicy taste as well. Overall this is ok and not as complex or flavorful as I like.
Nice dark wheat with a soft creamy head.  Unfortunately, I was eating a meal with this one. I'll definately have this one again in a meal of its own!

Pours brown with a medium tan head. Nose is a spicy malt with wheat and yeast characteristics. The taste is slong the same lines but there is a fruit taste coming through. Maybe banana mixed with citrus. Finishes very well with some more of the maltiness coming out. Great beer!

Better than the regular. Same cloudy orange but a different shade. Much darker brown. No head though on this one. Smells the same as the other except a bit nutty. The lemon flavor is evident but the little floral nuttiness comes through. Smooth and easily drinkable.
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2004 Apple cider appearance with some head and lacing.  Good banana esters coming through and lingering well after the swallow.  Sweet aroma of banana and yeast.  Decent enough !

Smells like mild banana and lots of yeast, quite sweet.  Appearance, as usual from this brewer, is just over the top.  Huge lasting head, tons of lacing, wonderful clouded ruby-brown color.  Opens up initially with a great candied like taste.  Lots of sugar, some subtle banana and lots of yeast, very peppery texture and lots of clove, almost too much at one point.  Very impressive, but as it settles and warms the taste starts leaving!  Come back!, but it dosent, begins to start feeling watery, taste gets way too subtle.  Flavor is wonderfully balanced but this beer just dosent make it to the end.  I did have a 22 oz.  Still, thought this would be bigger and badder and better than the regular hefe.  Still a good beer, just expecting more.
Not as good as I had hoped.  A little thick for my taste.  It did have a good aroma and a nice amount of head.
A nice, hearty wheat beer with spicy undertones and a sizable head. Not my favorite style, but I could have this again.

Nice yeasty aroma with some spice tones. Orangey-brown cloudy colour with big just off-white head that keeps on going. Full complex flavour with yeastiness, some banana, big cloves and other spices (nutmeg?), caramel with a good alcohol finish. Somewhat sweet. Good weight in the mouth and slides down smoothly. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed this beer and am looking forward to trying other examples of the style. Bottle.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2010 A buttery smooth malty taste with nice carbonation. The spices are more subtle than other German wheats I have tried. Well done, I must say. Update: Slight bump up with current tasting.

Very pretty in the glass, a gorgeous orangey-copper. The perfect, creamy off-white head lasts until the last sip. Tart berrylike aromas, yeasty, sourdough bread. Fruity with spicy flavors hinting at nutmeg, light toffeeish chocolate, a faint suggestion of banana, perhaps nutty? Prickly carbonation enhances the spiciness. Medium-light bodied with minimal bitterness. Clean, slightly tart finish. Try this with real Mexican dishes (not that fast food ground beef taco crap), or a fluffy omelet with goat cheese and chives.

Nice dark wheat aroma. Big carbonation, as it should have. Orangey-brown color, a bit lighter than I expected. Nice wheat-malt profile, banana, clove notes, caramel also. Not as much sediment at bottom of botlle as I would expect. Clean finish, refreshing, medium-light body. Very good beer.
Good strong wheat aroma, some spices. Looks are good, firm head. nutty, orange brown coloured; cloudy. Taste is good; wheaty, some citrus. Pleasant bitterness in the end. Fresh palate.
Unimpressed. Hazy dark brown. Spicy aroma. Sweet wheaty flavor. Medium-bodied. It was ok but it just seemed to be missing something.

Medium dark and cloudy with mammoth rocky head. Aroma is spicy with clove dominating over wheat malt and yeast. Medium bodied and smooth with no noticable bitterness. Flavor is of roasted wheat malt which is on the sweet side. Overall not a bad Dunkel.

text: (Draught) Foamy, white head and light brown body. Thin malty nose with slight tin. Slightly malty taste and caramel. Smooth. Light tart finish.

huge white head, glossy and rocky.  cloudy light brown body.  great esters, rich malty and butterscotch nose.  wheat and caramel.  smooth and full tasty and sweet some grains and some alcohol come through later.

Disappointing. I had read good things about HP and this was my first taste. I have another HP, hoping for better results. Overall taste and aftertaste...salty and bitter. Left me very dry and, perish the thought, in need of some water. Aroma unimpressive, appearance likewise. I will steer clear of this in the future.

Wow, why can't all wheat beers taste this good.  Nice head which dissipates to decent lacing with minimal carbonation.  Aroma is not as strong as a normal wheat beer.  The sickly/sweet grassy aroma is not as prominent.  There is some wheat, though,  with a little clove presence.  Color is a medium, cloudy amber.  Flavor is quite smooth and sits well in the stomach (in mine, at least, unlike some other wheat beers).  Flavor is slightly sweet with honey, wheat and some malt.  Finish is pretty clean with a lingering wheat aftertaste but not strong.  A very good variation on the traditional wheat beer.
I'm most partial to the Hefe-Weisse, but this goes down good, has a good alcohol kick to it, and just tastes good.
Wheat, bananas and cloves, cloudy brown, huge wheat sheaf head. Bananas and malt flavours? Medium bodied. A good beer, but I like the Hefe weisse a bit more.

Oh sweet caramel and root vegetables, remind me of Eastern earthy soils - take me back to buttered bread and turnips and nuts; creamy, delightful, and with a minimal hop close. Darn good, slightly more crisp and voila, and I'd have my name all over this one!

Hazy orange/brown in color with a tall style type light beige head.  Aroma of cocoa wheat with a hint of bananas. Malty and yeasty in flavor with a touch of tartness.  A mid level dunkle weiss.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2003 I'm not a big fan of "Dunkel" beers buit this one was very good. It had a very pleasant carmely, roasted, spiced flavor. I think my favorite "Dunkel-Weisse" beer is Ayinger's Ur-Weisse.

Big fluffy head and tremendous clove nose.  Lots of clove flavor with spice and wheat.  Some restrained banana too.  Darned nice.

Bottle.  A hazy brown color with a laced tan head.  A solid weizen like aroma with citrus, coriander, orange peel, and spice.  The dunkel side comes into the flavor with an added malt and grain character to the weizen spice.  Still, this beer is predominately a German Wheat.

Bottled under the Weisse Dark name. Good german wheat. Nice good flavor. Tons of head. Kind of a copper color.

Very smooth! Nice malt flavor mixed witht the banana clove flavor of the yeast.  This beer starts nice but finishes weak.
really malty.  Unlike other german beers it is better at room temp, then chilled.
Medicine, soap, grassy nose.  Small white head with fair lacing.  Light sweet flavors in the front, and finishes out with a dr light acidic.  Average.

Excellent Wheat - from the heady pour to the fresh banana-like aroma. Cloudy copper colored cloudy appearance. Good mouthfeel - pleasant clove-like aftertaste - doesn't interfere like the regular Weiss - blended in much better.

Medium brown color, large foamy head. Aroma is spicy and slightly yeasty. Medium bodied German Wheat. Malty and spicy. Lighter taste, yet lots of flavor. Yeasty and citrusy. Nice taste. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Very drinkable beer.

nice spicy aroma, amber brown color, nice beige head.  great taste with hints of clove, very nice

This is a 5.5% alcohol by volume dark wheat beer that pours with a cloudy, brown color very similar in appearance to a strongly brewed iced-tea. This beer is not labeled as a Hefe Weisse, which means that active yeasts were not added to the bottle for additional bottle fermentation and aging (Hefe is the German word for yeast, Weiß is the color white, as most wheat beers are light in color). When poured, this beer will produce a huge, creamy off-white colored head that settles very slowly in the glass, so you will want to be sure to pour slowly and gently. 

In the nose, this beer present the classic dark wheat beer aromas of cloves, some banana fruit, and yeast. It is a pleasant smell, something lighter than a freshly baked loaf of banana bread.
I cant say that I liked this one as much as the Ayinger Ur-Weisse or Hackers own Weisse Bock. Too much banana, not enough spice for me. Nonetheless a fine beer.
